programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bournemouth, Dorset, PR company owners Jackie and Richard are first to host, putting on a classy evening with a few celebrity names thrown in for good measure. Next, Ross and Hanne stake their claim to the £1,000 prize, before everyone is brought to the farm for Gail and Nigel's evening.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, an unusual Harley-Davidson motorbike, an antique flapper purse and a pair of solid gold coins keep Dan and his assistant Ellie busy doing high-end deals. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, staff broker a deal on a fur coat and ring, and a 100-year-old music player.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, London Road Pawnbrokers boss Dan hunts for a local artist regarding potentially valuable paintings, and an unusual silver sombrero could be worth a small fortune.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south London to catch up with identical twins Matt and Chris Wickham, who were looking to buy a place together on a budget of £350,000. The property experts also revisit trainee solicitor Jemma Pollock, who was searching for her first home with a little help from her father.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: A cosmetic tattooist from Hampshire searches for a home in the country with city connections, and Janet and Ron look to retire from London near their grandchildren in Hertfordshire.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Langside Bed and Breakfast in Fenwick, Scotland, where super-clean hosts Debbie and Jim McCalliog hope to wow their guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Liza Macias hosts the first party in Warwickshire and hopes wooing her diners with a French menu and three hunky waiters will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sailor Steve Aston hosts the second dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping his nautical-themed evening will impress the women in the group and win him the £1,000 prize. But what will the ladies think when they discover the secrets of his `love ship'?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Admin manager Emma Reddin hosts the third dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes to secure the £1,000 prize by offering her guests pea and potato samosas and a selection of Indian curries, and organising Bollywood dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PA Pinky Sidhu hosts the fourth dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping to educate her guests about the finer things in life with an evening of sophistication and pageantry. However, the diners quickly find fault with her starter and dessert, and there is a surprise winner of the beauty competition she arranged as entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Alison Firth hosts the final dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes that her 1980s disco-themed night featuring a marshmallow competition will impress her guests enough to see her win the cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jane Grote Abell, the Chairwoman of Donatos Pizza and daughter of the company's founder, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open her own restaurant. Her aim is to uncover where the company is going, what plans for the future should include and whether her father's values are still being upheld.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: In north Devon, Charlie Luxton discovers a Victorian sea captain's mansion in Ilfracombe, a new beachfront tower overlooking Croyde Bay, and an old lifeboat cottage in Appledore.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: The duo meet Karyn and Duncan, who have been arguing for more than two years about their three-bed semi in Stirlingshire. She wants to move on to somewhere bigger and better, while he loves the rural views afforded by their current home - not to mention the river at the bottom of the drive. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to bring them together again by helping them decide, once and for all, whether they should sell up or stay put.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First into the studio is 21-year-old Dom from Hampshire, who has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. Dom wants to find a girl who shares his love of adventure and isn't bothered by his posh boy charm. There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Diners include Sherry, a 65-year-old dominatrix looking for romance. She hopes chartered surveyor and t'ai chi enthusiast John might be the man for her. Meanwhile, Hannah, 40, is looking for a man who shares her love of adventure. Could 42-year-old Christmas tree farmer Rob be her Mr Right?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team's first patient is a West Highland terrier puppy that has a problem with its paws. Two new bionic feet later, and the poorly dog has a new lease of life. A young husky collie is also brought in after being hit by a car, only for the hip replacement operation to run into trouble, and a lazy dachshund requires double surgery and lots of physiotherapy.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: The mystery of red rain falling in Sri Lanka and India, how unusual weather is making Florida the sinkhole capital of the world, and strange lights in the sky that are baffling locals in a remote Norwegian town. Plus, ready-made snowballs in Alaska, giant spiderwebs covering trees in Pakistan, shard of ice sprouting from the ground in someone's back garden, and an underwater cloud in Mexico.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants from Bournemouth, Dorset, compete to host the best dinner party and win £1,000 cash prize. Sue and Shaun kick things off with a Mediterranean-inspired menu. Next, competitive newlyweds Sam and Emma show off their love of surfing with a laid-back evening, and John and Livi take charge for the final party when it's all about looking good.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a tank, and one customer wants £10,000 for his gold. Meanwhile, Nathan Finch is bewitched by some valuable paintings.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps house hunters in West Yorkshire and Sussex to find a home that provides them with both the peace and quiet of a rural idyll and convenient access to the city.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, owned by Rab and Gail Forbes, who opened their historic inn just six months previously.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five people from Swindon take turns trying to throw the perfect dinner party. International DJ Mark Eteson hosts the first night and hopes his Ibiza-style menu featuring Bora Bora Beach brownies, paella and fishcakes will be a hit, before challenging his guests to a rave-off which he will judge himself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amateur dramatics enthusiast Michaela Kearns hosts the second party in Swindon, but admits she is not much of a cook. She hopes to dazzle her guests with a glamour-filled evening featuring melted chocolate with dipping treats, but anticipates she might not be able to persuade her fellow diners to take part in her planned show tune performance - complete with a full band.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Financial advisor Scott Hillier hosts Swindon's third party, hoping to impress his guests with a Wild West-themed evening. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Direct sales manager Sally Rachael hosts the fourth dinner party in Swindon, featuring a `girls' night in' theme with mysteriously titled dishes and a quirky dress code that leaves her guests clueless and unhappy.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alternative therapist Gill Bright hosts the final dinner party in Swindon and has plans for an `upstairs downstairs' Edwardian-themed evening with sophisticated food followed by some circle dancing to Bob Marley.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. Owners Richard and Jorge's in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duo's suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. programme.title: Life Behind Bars: Visiting Hour
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the visiting room at HMP Low Moss, one of Scotland's largest maximum security prisons. It offers an insight into the people doing hard time as they meet loved ones. Featured contributors include Gary and Charley who plan their wedding, even though he doesn't have a release date. Meanwhile, fellow inmate Mike receives a visit from his ageing father.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper.(n)

programme.desc: The events that led Lorraine Thorpe to become Britain's youngest female double murderer at the age of 15. She and 41-year-old Paul Clarke tortured and killed their friend Rosalyn Hunt, before smothering Thorpe's father Desmond to death with a cushion after he threatened to go to the police. The programme features interviews with Rosalyn's brother as well as detectives from the joint Norfolk and Suffolk investigation team.(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: Dr. Evil is back...and has invented a new time machine that allows him to go back to the 60's and steal Austin Powers' mojo, inadvertently leaving him "shagless"(n)

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run
programme.desc: It's not easy to win back a woman after leaving her at the altar, but when an out-of-shape man finally realises just what a mistake he's made, he vows to run a high-profile marathon in order to convince his ex-fiancée that the rich and handsome man she's about to marry isn't the guy for her(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Andy Kaufman's public image changed like the weather: he was loved and hated in equal measure and his innovative style of humour was often misunderstood. He acknowledged that he didn't know what was funny or not, and his material could generate laughs and tears, silence and brawls(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this survival tale based on a true story, a 19th century frontiersman is left for dead after being attacked by his comrades, only to survive and claim his revenge(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this nail-biting adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: CIA agent Jack Ryan races to avert war between Russia and the US after a terrorist threatens to detonate a nuclear bomb(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia and daughter Ceci are happy in their New York apartment until stagnant water begins to seep through the roof. Is someone - or something - living upstairs? Psychological horror from the author of The Ring(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty
programme.desc: After her mother commits suicide, nineteen year old Lucy Harmon travels to Italy to have her picture painted. However, she has other reasons for wanting to go. She wants to renew her acquaintance with Nicolo Donati, a young boy with whom she fell in love on her last visit four years ago. She also is trying to solve the riddle left in a diary written by her dead mother, Sara(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Successful and single businesswoman Kate Holbrook is finally determined to have a kid on her own now that she is 37. But when she discovers that she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant, the driven Kate finds in working girl Angie Ostrowiski an unlikely surrogate. Everything is apparently going well. That until Angie shows up at Kate doorstep with no place to live. The two opposites try to get along and, in the middle of their tug-of-war, they discover that there can be a different kind of family(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: The American Basketball Association is on the verge of collapse, and when a former NBA benchwarmer returns to his hometown of Flint, MI, to whip his former team into shape for the playoffs, redemption is just a free throw away in this period sports comedy starring Will Ferrell and Woody Harrelson. Penned by Old School scribe Scot Armstrong, Semi-Pro tells the tale of a 1970s-era basketball player who doesn't have much luck in the NBA, but vows to leave his mark on the sport by coaching the Flint Tropics. When the upstart ABA league agrees to be absorbed by the NBA, only four teams will be allowed in. Jackie Moon (Ferrell) must orchestrate a successful season both on the court, and financially off the court with the help of many odd promotional events, in order to remain in the sport he loves(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: A brilliant scientist builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: A maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket after the latter is framed for a bombing in Paris. Soon, they combine their brawn and street smarts to investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night. A jarring apocalyptic pulse-pounder based on the 1954 sci-fi classic novel by Richard Matheson(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: Gripping Holocaust biopic with Adrien Brody as a gifted Polish-Jewish musician struggling to survive in the Warsaw ghetto. Brody dropped about 30 pounds to affect the emaciated look of a starving man. Roman Polanski scored Best Director. As a Jewish youngster in 1939 Krakow, Polanski witnessed the Nazi invasion. It's his first film shot in his native Poland since 1962's "Knife in the Water," his feature-film debut(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Based on the life of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens, who became the greatest track and field athlete in history at the world stage of the 1936 Olympics by winning four gold medals. He achieved this amazing feat under the gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The sleuth helps Esposito and Ryan launch an investigation into the mysterious death of a former child star, but emotions risk bubbling over when Beckett and McCord arrive to take over the case. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the stabbing of a teacher whose body has been found in a caretaker's cupboard. The hunt for her killer leads to the discovery that she was caught up in a love triangle at school involving a student with multiple identities. Legal drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a female rock singer, who apparently died of an overdose of cocaine and heroin. However, their inquiry is hampered by the appearance of a retired officer using unorthodox research tactics to find out the truth. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates an arson attack that looks like a case of revenge on an ex-lover and her new partner, leading him to meet Yelina. However, as events proceed, he finds himself with no option but to sack a team member whose personal problems are starting to disrupt the inquiry. Drama, starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a marine working for the Defence Intelligence Agency who was blamed for the disappearance of 500 specialised rifles in Afghanistan. A cryptic message found at the scene, written in the victim's blood, leads the agents on the trail of a controversial manuscript that claims to expose the truth about the missing weapons, and an FBI agent with a secret. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Drama following the fortunes of Olivia Lockhart, a small-town judge, both inside and away from the courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Luke's violent outburst puts his future at risk, and Olivia worries that Justine is refusing to give up on him. Meanwhile, Jack struggles to accept Eric's new job.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A notorious drug dealer is murdered and suspicion falls on two possible culprits - a priest with a reputation as a vigilante, and the father of a teenager who died of an overdose. Briscoe and Green attempt to discover whether either of them took the law into his own hands. Starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A witness to a jewellery store robbery that went tragically wrong fails to appear in court. McCoy suspects foul play - until it transpires the man has been on the run for the past 20 years. Police drama, guest starring Mandy Patinkin of Criminal Minds fame, with Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The body of a teenage TV talent show contestant is found dumped underneath a highway flyover, and CCTV footage implicates a fellow contestant, who is immediately brought in for questioning. However, a new lead prompts Grissom and the team to re-examine an unsolved case from the 1950s. With The Birds star Tippi Hedren.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New evidence reveals the serial killer has infiltrated the agency and is targeting a member of the NCIS team, prompting Gibbs to seek the guidance of his former mentor Mike Franks (Prison Break's Muse Watson). A lead from Barrett's squad reveals the CIA has also been tracking the murderer - and its findings suggest the culprit could be an even deadlier foe than anticipated.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team attend the funeral of a fallen colleague before resuming their hunt for the man they believe to be the port-to-port killer. Vance frantically researches the suspect's background to learn more about his motivations and discover who his next target could be - but one of the investigators follows a clue that leads to danger.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives trace the identities of two murdered teenagers and discover one had a sister who was travelling with them. Physical evidence implicates her in the crimes, but she claims to have been an unwilling accomplice. Ellen Pompeo (Grey's Anatomy) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Two men are implicated in the rape and murder of a Canadian student, and the team finds enough evidence to have them charged - but the disappearance of the sole witness forces the judge to dismiss the case. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A student's body is found dumped in an area frequented by prostitutes, and it soon becomes clear she was deeply involved in the worlds of online gambling and high-stakes poker. As the investigation proceeds, Stabler and Tutuola find themselves on the trail of a famous American footballer and an undercover police officer. Hard-hitting drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Ice-T.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Sergeant Benson is rescued by the squad following William Lewis's death. However, her strife continues when her actions are investigated by the Internal Affairs department, and head prosecutor Derek Strauss calls for her arrest. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella and Mac investigate murders inspired by magic tricks, including a woman sawn in half and a man burned to death. It emerges the victims were employees of a renowned illusionist who has the perfect alibi as he was performing the same stunts on himself at the time of the incidents. Meanwhile, Danny offers Lindsay support as she testifies in court.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.sub-title: A Daze of Wine and Roaches.
programme.desc: A woman dies at a French Revolution-themed event co-hosted by the 15-year-old socialite she tutored. Meanwhile, a live cockroach encrusted with jewels gives Danny and Lindsay clues to the death of a promising chef, and leads them to the designer responsible for the unorthodox ornament. Crime drama, with Anna Belknap, Carmine Giovinazzo and Eddie Cahill.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Tensions mount as Pete confronts Benny about the blaze that killed his father, while Severide and Casey are given food for thought as they investigate a string of suspicious restaurant fires. Casey struggles to control his feelings for Darden's widow, and Shay takes the next step toward starting a family of her own.(n)

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a struggling actress in what appears to have been a bungled robbery. programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. programme.title: The Book of Eli
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic action about a solitary warrior who fights to protect the last known copy of a powerful book. Decades after a nuclear war, a lone man calling himself Eli trudges through the dilapidated cities and scorched wilderness of America, carrying his copy of the Bible, a sacred book that provides 'contentment for the weak-minded'. On an odyssey to bring the text to a sacred place, Eli brings God's wrath down on the robbers, murderers and rapists who lie in wait along the highways. Driven by faith and divine calling, Eli's endeavour becomes harder when he meets the power-hungry Carnegie, who tutors an army of psychopathic rogues and gunmen in a small town. Hoping to steal the book he believes is his last chance to rule what is left of humanity, Carnegie sets out to catch Eli, while Carnegie's step-daughter also follows Eli on his quest. As Carnegie and his henchmen hunt Eli down, they soon discover what a powerful and fearsome adversary he really is(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: Catherine Hardwicke hands on the directorial baton to Chris Weitz for this second part of the cinematic adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's teen vampire saga. The chapter opens with Bella Swan (Kristen Stewart) on the cusp of her 18th birthday and blissfully happy with her undead beau Edward Cullen. But, while she's celebrating her birthday with Edward's family of 'vegetarian' vampires, a frightening incident convinces Edward that he's simply too dangerous to be around his sweetheart. He leaves the town of Forks in order to ensure her safety - leaving her behind, angry and depressed. Bella finds some relief from her emotional numbness through recklessly riding motorbikes and succumbing to the attentions of her friend Jacob Black. But he is also a supernatural being, and not one with a natural affinity to vampires..(n)

programme.desc: "That's not a knife. This is a knife" is among cinema's best known quotes, as the eponymous Mick 'Crocodile' Dundee routs a New York mugger in Peter Faiman's Oscar-nominated comedy. Hogan, a national institution Down Under, broke into the big time with this film, playing an Outback crocodile hunter who attracts the attention of American journalist Sue Charlton. After she shares his life and dangers in the bush, she invites him to New York, an environment that's alien to Dundee but one he adapts to with charm and humour as he and Charlton slowly fall in love (as did Hogan and Kozlowski during the filming - they married soon after)(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: Gavin O'Connor's New York-set police corruption thriller starring Edward Norton, Colin Farrell and Jon Voight. When four cops are shot dead in a drugs bust gone bad, detective Ray Tierney is persuaded by his father, NYPD chief Francis Sr, to lead the investigation into what went wrong. But as Ray delves further, it becomes ever more apparent that the corruption he uncovers no only threatens scandal for the Washington Heights precinct, but is also likely to rip apart his own family, most of whom are also in the force(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Orin Hanner is a rich man intent on becoming richer by allowing toxic waste to be dumped into abandoned mineshafts. His scheme hits a snag when a mysterious stranger breezes into town with a guitar, a gun and a leather jacket. Action(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: 'On any given Sunday you're gonna win or you're gonna lose. The point is - can you win or lose like a man?' Macho stuff from director Oliver Stone , with a cast of heavyweights from both cinema and pro sport(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson star in this outrageous cult comedy. An intellectually challenged male model finds himself involved in political espionage and assassination. Dir: Ben Stiller(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Controversial and often offensive stand-up comedian Andrew Dice Clay made his debut as a feature film star in this crude comedy. Fairlane is a "rock and roll detective" who works in the music business, has an office on Sunset Boulevard, and drives a 1957 Ford, with clothing to match. He floats through the rock clubs of Hollywood, picking up women and clients, and soon stumbles into a case involving the death of a heavy metal singer, a corrupt music executive (Wayne Newton), the murder of a radio shock-jock (Gilbert Gottfried), and the kidnapping of the jock's daughter (Maddie Corman). Music stars like Sheila E. and Motley Crue singer Vince Neil also have cameos in the film, which attempts to transplant Clay's aggressively obnoxious stage persona into a movie environment(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Cigar-chomping demon Hellboy (Ron Perlman), the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense's secret weapon against things that go bump in the night, returns to battle a supernatural prince with an ancient grudge against puny humans(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner (Bruce Willis) might be responsible, but they later realize that the heists point toward a much larger conspiracy. Christopher Meloni, Dave Bautista, and Adrian Grenier co-star in this crime thriller directed by Steven C. Miller(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Leonardo DiCaprio plays aCIA agent on the ground in Jordan, chasing a powerful terrorist leader(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: In this action thriller, a master car thief has his skills pushed to the limit. Randall "Memphis" Raines (Nicolas Cage) can steal practically any car that crosses his path. While he has done well in his life of crime, he knows that there's a short future in theft, and he wants to get out of the business. But his retirement plans are interrupted when his younger brother Kip (Giovanni Ribisi) gets in trouble with a dangerous crime boss. To get his brother out of harm's way, Randall agrees to a profitable but risky scheme to steal 50 luxury cars in one night, with the help of several other car thieves, including Sara "Sway" Wayland (Angelina Jolie). A rival group of thieves is trying to pull the same stunt at the same time, and detectives Castlebeck (Delroy Lindo) and Drycoff (Timothy Olyphant) are trying to shut down both operations. Also starring Robert Duvall as Otto Halliwell, and Scott Caan as Tumbler, Gone in Sixty Seconds is a remake of the 1974 low-budget action hit of the same name, best remembered for a 40-minute chase scene in which 90 cars were destroyed(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Finding Forrester star Rob Brown steps into the cleats of Heisman Trophy-winning gridiron giant Ernie Davis in director Gary Fleder's inspirational sports docudrama. As a young boy reared not far from the northern Pennsylvania state line, Davis dreamed of blasting through the end zone and scoring a triumphant touchdown while fans rose to their feet and cheered. When Davis later became a star running back for the Syracuse Orangemen, his dreams were finally on the way to becoming a reality. Under the wing of coach Ben Schwartzwalder (Dennis Quaid), it seemed as if there is nothing that could stop Davis from entering into the annals of sports history; even during an era in which the civil rights movement was just gaining momentum, this fledgling gridiron giant never once doubted his ability to rise to the top. When Davis was diagnosed with leukemia shortly after being drafted into the NFL, however, his will to survive soon eclipsed his dreams of success(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: A programmer is transported into a computer mainframe by the malevolent MCP – Master Control Program. There, he and programs within the mainframe who oppose the tyrannical MCP are forced to fight for their survival in martial games. Considered a landmark in early computer animation(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Based on the cult-favorite "giant worm" film of the same name, the weekly, hour-long Tremors: The Series found Michael Gross repeating his screen role as neurotic worm-buster Burt Gummer. The series took place in the ironically yclept community of Perfection Valley, NV, where all manner of huge and slimy creatures have wrought havoc from beneath the ground. In the tradition of Roswell, NM, Perfection Valley has profited mightily from its disastrous past experiences with such slithery species as the Graboids, the Shriekers, and the AssBlasters, with ex-hippie Nancy Sterngood (Marcia Strassman) growing wealthy by selling ceramic statues of the aforementioned creatures over the Internet, and hot rodder-cum-pilot Tyler Reed (Victor Browne) managing the lucrative "Desert Jack's Graboid Tours." Also on the premises was Department of the Interior agent W.D. Twitchell (Dean Norris), whose job it was to put up bureaucratic barriers against killing off the various and sundry super-worms because of their "endangered species" status. Meanwhile, Burt Gummer, often working in concert with grocer Jodi Chang (Lela Lee) and rancher Rosalita Sanchez (Gladys Jimenez), did his best to protect Perfection Valley from any and all future creepy-crawly invaders -- and when the worms came out anyway (as they always did), Burt utilized a veritable arsenal of jerry-built weaponry to thwart the yucky scourges. Tremors: The Series debuted over cable's Sci-Fi Channel (surprise, surprise!) on March 28, 2003(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening matches on day three of the tournament at the All England Club, where the second round of the singles is set to get under way.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further second-round coverage from the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' second-round singles matches are scheduled to continue. Andy Murray will be involved on one of the show courts this afternoon, and is scheduled to face Dustin Brown, who caused a sensation at SW19 two years ago when he defeated Rafael Nadal at this stage of the competition. The world number will hope to avoid a similar fate against the German as he continues his attempt to win this Grand Slam for the third time in his career, and will hope to replicate the form he produced in beating Alexander Bublik 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 in the first round on Monday.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Zoe Ball host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: Nick Hewer asks if the banks are being unfair in how they handle scamming cases and a plumbing firm's outrageous overcharging is exposed. Plus, a test into whether one of the country's most familiar companies is offering new customers a service it knows it can't deliver, along with live consumer advice and the latest on stories making news.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Young landlords Dan and Jamie are given a reality check in Co Durham when they move into their tenant Michael's home. At first, they are blase about the jobs that need doing, but when they come face to face with Michael everything is thrown into question. In Leeds, old feelings and difficult memories are raked up for millionaire Prab when he is taken back to his own impoverished childhood.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Richard Ayoade, Alun Cochrane and Gabby Logan competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including people who laugh out loud when reading a book, fun and half and half scarves.(n)

programme.title: Bus Wars
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the fierce competition between big bus tour companies in Belfast as they fight for a share of the lucrative tourist market. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Tina Daheley is live with Avon and Somerset's underwater search team and Rav Wilding finds out about a new system being used at one prison to stop drones being used.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martel Maxwell and Dion Dublin explore properties in Telford in Shropshire, Derby and Coulsdon, Surrey, speaking to the owners about their plans.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: Si King visits the show garden designed for blind veterans, Dave Myers learns about growing cocktail ingredients and chef Adrian Luckie makes his signature jerk chicken.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: When a post office is raided by two knifemen, the owner takes them on so his employees can escape. A man gets his comeuppance after robbing an elderly woman.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott presents the competition from Hay-on-Wye, Powys, where teams are guided by experts Charles Hanson and Jonathan Pratt through plenty of highs and lows. Meanwhile, the presenter stumbles across an interesting find with a well-travelled past.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from the All England Club, as the second-round matches continue in the men's and ladies' singles. Two of the more notable clashes in the bottom half of the men's draw scheduled to take place today are Juan Martin del Potro v Ernests Gulbis, and Adam Pavlasek v Novak Djokovic, and they are made all the more enticing by the fact that should Del Potro and Djokovic overcome their respective opponents, it will set up an intriguing clash between the pair in round three. Djokovic's pedigree on the grass courts of Wimbledon is excellent, having won the tournament three times, most recently in 2015, and despite struggling to find his best form this year, he did triumph at the AEGON International in Eastbourne last week, in preparation for this year's Grand Slam.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Abi learns of Steven's intentions to spy on Lauren using the camera on her phone charger and questions why he is bothering when he could just have her instead. Louise is put out to learn Alexandra is taking her place in the showcase, Sonia meets Bex's school teacher to check on her daughter's progress and Max takes Carmel for a drink at the Vic. Karen starts work as a cleaner at Beale's and Robbie searches desperately for Dot's missing cat.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence and Kev visit a second-hand car dealer who sold a vehicle with a dangerous flaw, and pay a visit to a technology company with a High Court writ. Ken Warby takes on one of the UK's biggest companies. But he has to find them first. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: New series. The genealogy documentary follows 10 more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is actor Charles Dance, who has made his name playing aristocrats - a far cry from his own background, having been born to a parlour maid. He wants to know if he comes from a long line of servants or if he can uncover some grander origins. The actor is also determined to find out about his father, who died when he was four and about whom he knows hardly anything - a search that takes him to the other side of the world.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Burton-upon-Trent, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Pam Ayres to pick the TV shows that shaped her life, with the poet's selection including one of the scariest series ever broadcast on British TV.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The art of the auctioneer is examined, the show's experts give tips about buying and selling in the saleroom and there is a look behind the scenes to find out what goes into filming an episode of Flog It! Paul Martin presents.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the red and blue teams find bargains at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, while host Anita Manning explores the city's castle.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Erika Levi meets some of the athletes hoping to win medals for Great Britain at the 2017 Deaflympics in Turkey, which begin later this month.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Selin Kiazim, Mike Reid and Tom Kemble continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's London and South East final.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Including coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents as the third day's play continues at the All England Club, with the men's and ladies' singles second-round matches scheduled to fill the famous grass courts. Among the contests scheduled to take place today are those in the bottom half of the women's draw, which will include Simona Halep v Beatriz Haddad Maia, Elina Svitolina v Francesca Schiavone, and Madison Keys v Camila Giorgi. Halep is among the favourites to lift the Venus Rosewater dish at SW19 this year, and after recording a straight-sets victory over Marina Erakovic in round one, will hope to emulate that performance today against Maia, who progressed to this match by beating Great Britain's Laura Robson on Monday.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the third day's play from the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' singles were due to continue with round two. Places in the last 32 of each draw were at stake and the players should have got used to the pace and bounce of the grass courts by now, although the seeds are still particularly vulnerable at this stage of the tournament.(n)

programme.title: RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show
programme.desc: New series. Monty Don and Joe Swift take a first look at the Royal Horticultural Society's Hampton Court Palace Flower Show, and are joined by a team of experts to review the diverse range of show gardens and discover how award-winning designer Andy Sturgeon is recycling Chelsea Flower Show gardens of the past. Arit Anderson reveals the stories behind the conceptual gardens, while Carol Klein is in the floral marquee and Rachel de Thame demonstrates how to get the most out of flowering border plants.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow patients at St Mary's who face a long wait, including a woman with serious mental health issues. There is also footage of patients and their loved ones coping with dementia, including a wife who is her 75-year-old husband's sole carer, and is at breaking point, partly due to his aggressive outbursts.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Erika Levi meets some of the athletes hoping to win medals for Great Britain at the 2017 Deaflympics in Turkey, which begin later this month.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with La-vern, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Rielly family lower their food bills, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their weekly food shop. The pair have a challenge on their hands as each member of the busy family have very different eating habits, meaning mum Stacy cooks 3 different dinners every night, including meals for her son Harry, who has Type 1 diabetes.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Stephen K Amos joins Brian Conley to look back at the TV shows that shaped him, and led him to become a comedian. From the singing pigs Pinky and Perky, to the terrifying Tales of the Unexpected by way of entertainer Danny la Rue, Stephen's early small-screen influences are wide and varied - but why does he believe he owes his entire career to TV adverts for vacuum cleaners?.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team advise on what to look for among the best of British objects, plus a follow-up with one visitor who put the proceeds of their sale to interesting use.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as two teams search for antiques at the East of England Showground in Peterborough, with the help of experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton hosts the grand final of the pastry chef contest, with the contestants spending eight hours preparing specially themed desserts with an elaborate sculptural centrepiece for a party attended by more than 100 guests at Firle Place, Sussex. Judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin assess their efforts, and decide who is this year's champion.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker is at the All England Club, as day four of the third Grand Slam tournament of the year gets under way, featuring the men's and ladies' second-round matches. Players from the bottom half of the men's draw and the top half of the ladies' draw are expected to be in action today, which means the crowds may well be treated to Milos Raonic v Mikhail Youzhny, Gael Monfils v Kyle Edmund, and Angelique Kerber v Kirsten Flipkens, among others. For Great Britain's Edmund, this is the first time in his career he has progressed to the second round at SW19, and having battled past compatriot Alexander Ward last time out, now faces a stern test in Frenchman Monfils. Meanwhile, as the top seed in the ladies' tournament, Kerber will be expected to overcome the unseeded Flipkens, although the Belgian has shown in the past she is capable of performing well on grass, having reached the semi-finals as recently as 2013.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the fourth day's play at the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' second-round singles were scheduled to conclude. Places in the last 32 were at stake with matches in the top half of the ladies' draw and the bottom half of the men's, as the quest to succeed Andy Murray and Serena Williams as champions continued.(n)

programme.title: RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show
programme.desc: Further coverage of the annual horticultural event in south-west London. Monty Don tours the new RHS Kitchen Garden, and Joe Swift takes a look around a garden designed for blind veterans. Carol Klein sees the different varieties on display in the Rose Marquee, Nick Bailey reveals the science behind scent and Adam Frost continues his series looking at how best to use plants in a dream garden.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Hal Cruttenden, Ed Gamble and Zoe Lyons. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by James O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: George Best: All By Himself
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the reserved young football prodigy from Belfast who became a global superstar, but whose career was blighted by his battle with the pressures of fame. The film reveals how the player dubbed El Beatle helped Manchester United to win two league titles and the European Cup, but his extravagant lifestyle led to various problems, most notably alcoholism.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in the heart of academia in Oxford, Michael Portillo visits the Bodleian library to see some Victorian treasures, including Mary Shelley's Frankenstein manuscript and a pocket-sized edition of Bradshaw's Companion. At Bicester, he investigates two new rail projects, finds out about Victorian philanthropy in Bedford and finishes in Luton, where he explores the dark arts of the hat-maker.(n)

programme.title: Sound of Cinema: The Music That Made the Movies
programme.desc: Neil Brand looks at how developing technology has taken film soundtracks in new directions and changed perceptions on how they should be made. He tries his hand at playing a theremin, the early Russian instrument that Miklos Rozsa used to evoke a sense of psychological disturbance in Alfred Hitchcock's movies and talks to Vangelis, who shares his inspiration for the Chariots of Fire and Blade Runner scores. The presenter also interviews Walter Murch and Carter Burwell, before Clint Mansell explains how electronic technology allowed him to become an acclaimed composer despite his lack of formal musical training. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Spies of Warsaw
programme.desc: Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's two-part adaptation of Alan Furst's spy novel concludes. Jean-Francois Mercier's mission becomes all too dangerous when his cover is compromised while trying to unearth German military plans. After travelling to Czechoslovakia to find and question the elusive `Seagull', Mercier finds his superiors becoming increasingly frustrated with his risk-taking and lack of protocol. Anna Skarbek is devastated after she receives news about ex-lover Max Mostov and heads to Spain on mission of mercy for the League of Nations. Starring David Tennant and Janet Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: Modern Times
programme.desc: The hereditary title of duke has been bestowed by British monarchs for reasons ranging from a grateful nation rewarding a major war leader to a king acknowledging his illegitimate son. However, the last dukedom was created by Queen Victoria and this documentary examines what will happen as they gradually become extinct due to lack of a male heir. Featuring interviews with the Duke of Marlborough and his Aunt Rosemary, the Duke of Atholl, the Duke of Montrose, the Duchess of Rutland and the Duke and Duchess of St Albans.(n)

programme.title: The Renaissance Unchained
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak challenges received wisdom about the cultural movement that began in the Late Medieval period. He begins by examining the notion of the Renaissance having fixed origins in Italy, showcasing the ingenuity in both technique and ideas of great artists including Van Eyck, Memling, Van der Weyden, Cranach, Riemenschneider and Durer.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: As a boy, frogs were the first animals David Attenborough kept and today he is still just as passionate about them. In this film, he takes viewers into the weird and wonderful world of the amphibian, shedding new light on the charismatic, colourful and frequently bizarre creatures, and examining their anatomy, extraordinary behaviour and ability to survive in some of the most extreme places on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Climate Change by Numbers
programme.desc: The debate surrounding climate change, as the public appears to be less sure it understands exactly what is going on, despite there being more information on the issue than ever. Mathematicians Dr Hannah Fry, Professor Norman Fenton and Professor David Spiegelhalter discuss the three key numbers that clarify the important questions around climate change, as scientists use them to help explain what is happening to the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long present the February 23 show, featuring Hot Chocolate, Rockwell, Nik Kershaw, Carmel and Howard Jones.(n)

programme.title: Castles - Britain's Fortified History
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis charts how Edward I turned the castle into an instrument of colonisation. He spent a large amount of money on subduing the Welsh and built fearsome fortresses in Caernarfon, Gwynedd and Beaumaris, which were used to impose England's rule on the country. However, when the king's attention turned to Scotland, his plans didn't go as expected.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Strange Signals from Outer Space!.
programme.desc: The scientists scouring the universe for signs of extraterrestrial life, including the film researchers at the Green Bank Telescope searching for radio signals from 'Tabby's Star', a star so mysterious some scientists believe it might be surrounded by a Dyson Sphere - a vast energy collector built by advanced aliens. The film also features the 2006 discovery by husband and wife team Duncan Lorimer and Maura McLaughlin of an enigmatic signal from space, known as a fast radio burst, and its subsequent explanations.(n)

programme.title: Aliens: The Big Think
programme.desc: The search for extraterrestrials is no longer sci-fi - it is a question engaging some of the greatest minds in science. This documentary gets inside the minds of scientists exploring the possibilities of what could be out there, including Professor Martin Rees, the Astronomer Royal, who thinks the common idea of organic aliens is all wrong.(n)

programme.title: Guts: The Strange and Wonderful World of the Human Stomach
programme.desc: TV presenter Michael Mosley takes part in an experiment at the Science Museum in London, where a small pill camera takes viewers on a journey through his digestive system. He visits a gastroenterologist, who explains the link between personality and pain response, and learns about the advent of faecal transplants increasingly used to treat people with serious stomach and bowel disorders.(n)

programme.title: WRC Review
programme.desc: All the thrills and spills from Rally Poland, round eight of the FIA World Rally Championship. First established in 1921, Rally Poland is one of the world's oldest rallies.(n)

programme.title: British Rally Championship Highlights

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will is far from impressed when Jack's childhood babysitter moves in with them, while Grace suffers an identity crisis. Starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing, with guest stars Demi Moore and Rosanna Arquette.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: A stranger reveals to the Barones that Frank used to be his mentor - much to the bemusement of Ray and Robert, who find it hard to believe their father could ever have inspired anyone. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Peter Boyle and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert and Ray end up with the mother of all guilt trips when they decide not to help Marie with a home project so they can land a prime spot on the golf course.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A workmate agrees to teach Frasier enough Hebrew to deliver the speech at his son Frederick's bar mitzvah, but the arrangement ends in double-dealing and mutual recrimination. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: In the first of a three-part story, Frasier struggles to replace Daphne and ends up hiring a woman who proves to be completely unsuitable. Meanwhile, Niles experiences an amazing chain of events, including winning the same competition twice and having his car struck by lightning.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part two of three. While Niles waits to undergo his heart bypass operation, Frasier tries to keep everyone's spirits up by describing the procedure in detail - a brainwave that leaves Daphne more depressed than ever. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jane Grote Abell, the Chairwoman of Donatos Pizza and daughter of the company's founder, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open her own restaurant. Her aim is to uncover where the company is going, what plans for the future should include and whether her father's values are still being upheld.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Frankie and Gill Phibbs search for the home they have always dreamt of owning on Spain's Costa de la Luz. It has taken 20 years for the couple's plans to come to fruition and, having sold their family home in West Sussex and with a budget of £180,000, the pair are keen to seize the day and embark on their new life.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Swansea and Bridgend compete to throw the best dinner party. Kathy and Justin kick off the competition with an Italian-inspired menu, which is overshadowed by Paul's poor table manners and tactless banter. Mark and Maria are the next to host and serve their leftovers-inspired starter, chicken lettuce boats. Finally, it's time for Kathy to wreak revenge during Paul and Sarah's evening. Chaos in the kitchen ensues, culminating in a showdown at the table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Engaged couple Kay Havard and Paul Young wish to buy a holiday home for romantic weekends away and to share with family and friends. Scarlette Douglas does her best to impress them with five properties on Spain's Costa Blanca for their budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps two sets of house hunters in Staffordshire and Warwickshire, looking to find both the buzz of the city and the peace of the country.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Julie and James host at the Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, where the guests are impressed by their rooms, but once again luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime want more from their beds.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week in Edinburgh is South-African born family man Sindiso, who hopes an evening of fun inspired by his homeland will win him the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart is awarded a driving licence for saving Springfield from a fire, and finds himself tied down when he develops a serious relationship with a teenage girl in a nearby town. Meanwhile, Lisa lands herself in trouble by falsely claiming Native American heritage. With the voice of Natalie Portman.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna confides in Farrah about wanting Warren to open up more, and Lisa offers Maxine and Adam the outdoor space at the Loveboat to set up a beach bar. Meanwhile, Prince and Hunter are furious when Shane worms his way back into the McQueen's.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Kaneez is initially furious to discover that Nas is considering the arranged marriage, but the pressure of planning the wedding and her web of lies leads Nas to break down to her mum and confess that she is gay. While focusing on helping Missy get Hayley back and also straightening out Simone, Emma neglects Chloe on her birthday, sending Chloe off the rails, while Steve battles with Mandy's indiscretion, leaving him wondering whether they have a future together after all.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: New series. The satirical comedy soap opera about the royal family returns. Prince Charles refuses to help Theresa May secure a trade deal with the Chinese, but when Camilla withholds his conjugal rights, Charles agrees to host a banquet. Wills wants to be a hands-on dad, mixing with ordinary parents, but comes to realise childcare is a nightmare, while Pippa is preparing to marry Johnny, but is enraged that Kate has been made patron of Wimbledon and decides to put a gypsy curse on her.(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Ray and Nikki plot revenge against Yuri and Meemo, but are forced to use caution when they see them with their boss, while Emmit and Sy listen to Varga's plan to expand Stussy Lots. Gloria and Winnie want to question Emmit, but Varga sits in on their meeting, so the two officers then head off to try to talk to Ray, who refuses to answer his door and then checks into a motel with Nikki.(n)

programme.title: Life Behind Bars: Visiting Hour
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the visiting room at HMP Low Moss, one of Scotland's largest maximum security prisons. It offers an insight into the people doing hard time as they meet loved ones. Featured contributors include Gary and Charley who plan their wedding, even though he doesn't have a release date. Meanwhile, fellow inmate Mike receives a visit from his ageing father.(n)

programme.title: 50 Shades of Gay
programme.desc: Rupert Everett explores the changes in gay life in the 50 years since the decriminalisation of male homosexuality in England and Wales in 1967. He meets LGBT people from all walks of life, including former royal butler Paul Burrell, rapper Jai'Rouge, actors from Hollyoaks, and Essex carpenter Steve, and visits Hebden Bridge in West Yorkshire, known as the lesbian capital of Britain.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on the fall-out from the General Election, Come Dine with Me and the classic Robin Williams film Mrs Doubtfire.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of Brothers and Sisters.
programme.desc: Documentary, filmed during a family camping holiday in the woods, exploring what it is like to be a younger sibling, including how they assert their independence around dominant older brothers and sisters. Scientists follow the children's every move and have devised a series of tasks, including nature sculptures, quizzes and tugs of war, to put their relationships to the test.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps three homeowners struggling to sell their property in West Sussex, including Indie, who needs to create a lounge from scratch in an old post office room. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out Homes
programme.desc: The traditional home is changing as the boundaries between house and garden blur. Now architect Zac Monro, engineer Monty Ravenscroft and gardener Rosie Bines use imagination, technology and ingenuity to tear down the walls of seven houses across Britain, creating homes and outside spaces that unlock the potential of living inside and out like never before. To begin they create a glass atrium for an 18th-century barn by covering a courtyard with a bespoke glass roof, and turn the garden of a Victorian semi in Manchester into the heart of a family home.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples who are struggling to find suitable flats in Edinburgh because of the competitive market and their demanding search criteria. The first, Matt, a professional rugby player and his girlfriend Amy, have viewed more than 100 properties without success. The second pair, Sarah and Dom, are relocating from London with their one-year-old son and have a £600,000 budget, but too many special requirements for their dream home.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Fagmalion Part Three: Bye, Bye, Beardy.
programme.desc: Part three of four. Will and Jack put the finishing touches to Barry's makeover before launching his new look at a charity event, and Karen meets an old rival.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Fagmalion Part Four: The Guy Who Loved Me.
programme.desc: Part four of four. A jealous Will spots Barry on a date with Jack and struggles to keep his feelings in check. Meanwhile, Karen pretends she is Rosario's maid to woo a good-looking maintenance worker. American comedy series, starring Eric McCormack, Sean Hayes and Dan Futterman.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank and Marie announce their plans to move into a retirement home in New Jersey - much to the relief of their family. While Robert is overjoyed to be getting his hands on his parents' house at last, Debra is surprised to find she has misgivings about losing touch with her in-laws.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Ray visit Frank and Marie, only to learn they are facing eviction from their new home - so Robert is forced to let them move back in with him. American comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part three of three. As Niles continues to recover from open-heart surgery, he masks his fear of death with overconfidence and an elaborate show of zest for life. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: As the Christmas season draws near, Frasier is furious to learn that Daphne and Niles want to host the family get-together, prompting a feud between the brothers. Meanwhile, Roz finds herself falling for a department store Santa Claus. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The brothers visit a luxury spa, where they are astonished to discover they are not enjoying the highest level of service and try to sneak into an area reserved exclusively for its most valued members. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Blackpool couple Julie and Brent Birnie find a holiday home close to Florida's theme park capital, Orlando. They're amazed by what their budget of £70,000 can buy them, but it remains to be seen which property will suit them best.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Blackpool compete to win the £1,000 prize, including former dancer Rowan and businessman John, who start the proceedings. Also vying to win are Sally and Joanne who hope to impress their guests with an unusual menu that features a Tandoori Tower and a belly-busting breakfast, before competitive duo Holly and Ollie pull out all the stops in an attempt to secure the cash.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals that owners Lynette and David want big money for. programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Greg Rusedski playing umpire in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps reality TV star and choreographer Louie Spence and his husband Leto Fernandez find a home in Spain's Almeria Province for £185,000 or less.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a Kent couple who want to downsize and move closer to London, and a couple who find their home in the commuter belt of Berkshire and Buckinghamshire too remote.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery, where the high level of finish in the rooms surprises all of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Edinburgh security company manager Anne hopes her homely, relaxed night in will be enough to win the £1,000 prize - but rising tensions between the guests may scupper her chances.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A documentary film-maker visits Springfield to see how the town's residents are progressing, making Homer worry he will not be seen as a success. In an attempt to convince the director of his so-called achievements, he borrows Mr Burns' summer mansion, but his cunning plan does not have the desired effect. With the voice of Eric Idle.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace thinks she knows where Bart is buried, Cindy uses Simone's past against her in the campaign trail, and Darcy manipulates Jesse into asking her to move in. Elsewhere, Courtney finds out that her controlling Grandmother is planning to visit so she decides to go on holiday.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Bengal cat called Tia is rushed in to Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a car. Noel Fitzpatrick faces the painstakingly difficult task of reconstructing Tia's tiny bones using a combination of rods and pins. Whippet Wobble, a rescue dog, is so badly injured that Noel has no choice but to perform a high-risk operation, and Alfie, a labrador care-dog, arrives at the surgery in need of help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan taking on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan, and Bill Bailey in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin, Scarlett and Mason search frantically for Brody, while Marilyn is frustrated that John seems to be avoiding her. Roo comes to a decision about the daughter she gave away.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Leo begs David to get painkillers for Mannix from the hospital, leading to a fall-out between the pair. Paige is unsettled by Elly's interest in Mark, while Xanthe hits rock-bottom.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team goes in search of a stolen radiotherapy canister that could have been used to make a bomb after a man impersonating a Navy Seal dies after being set on fire. Meanwhile, team leader Hetty Lange has been acting strangely and Callen offers to help with whatever is troubling her. Guest starring Claire Forlani (Camelot), with Chris O'Donnell and Linda Hunt.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: A woman is blinded following an accident in which her husband and child are killed. She employs a nurse as a carer, only to discover he has developed a dangerous obsession with her, which turns violent as she begins to regain her independence. Thriller, starring Elisabeth Rohm, Sam Page and Shannon Elizabeth. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Leo begs David to get painkillers for Mannix from the hospital, leading to a fall-out between the pair. Paige is unsettled by Elly's interest in Mark, while Xanthe hits rock-bottom.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
