programme.desc: Granville decides a fashion makeover is needed to impress Stephanie from the local boutique, but Arkwright's meddling soon puts paid to any romantic dalliance. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to improve the sale of an overstocked commodity with incredible efficiency, and Granville's lust for power leads to disaster. Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: In the first episode of the classic sitcom, beleaguered and badgered hotelier Basil Fawlty tries to attract a better class of clientele, but ends up being taken to the cleaners by the first seemingly upper-crust customer to check in. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A weeping statue in the local church gives Del an idea for a money-making scheme to help a hospice under threat of closure. However, his efforts are thwarted by the weather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Outspoken funnyman Frankie Boyle hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before handing over to the acerbic Simon Evans and actress/stand-up Aisling Bea.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark makes a new friend at the office who seems likely to broaden his horizons. Meanwhile, Jeremy meets an acquaintance from school who wants him to star in his art-house movie. David Mitchell, Robert Webb and Olivia Colman star.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The hard-up housemates strike oil in the basement, and think they have found the answer to their financial woes. However, super-smooth Mike decides the time is ripe for a coup, and declares himself house-dictator. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Ade Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.sub-title: The Black Adder: The Queen of Spain's Beard.
programme.desc: Edmund seems set for a change of luck in the lottery of love thanks to a slip-up by the King - but soon discovers the charming princess he meets is not all she is cracked up to be. Guest starring Miriam Margolyes and Jim Broadbent, with Rowan Atkinson and Brian Blessed.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Outspoken funnyman Frankie Boyle hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before handing over to the acerbic Simon Evans and actress/stand-up Aisling Bea.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Miss Postern is given the task of running the draughts club and suggests merging with Mr Church's chess fanatics, so he invites her to his place to discuss the idea - but soon regrets his first attempt at social networking. Meanwhile, Mr Gunn is spotted with a drug dealer and a scandal looms, but who is the addict? Classroom comedy, starring David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Skits and sketches from comedy duo Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders, including a spoof of Baywatch, a secret gathering of gritty crime drama actresses and Helen Mirren trying to reinvent herself as the star of a family friendly sitcom. Guest starring Julia Sawalha and Dusty Springfield.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Andy and Lou buy an unusual pet, while Vicky Pollard has a meeting with the governess at borstal. Samantha gets Edward Grant a birthday card and Peter Andre tries to sneak into a royal garden party. With Matt Lucas and David Walliams.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: College students cause chaos during their traditional rag-week fundraiser, stretching the local constabulary's patience to breaking point. Unfortunately DI Grim has other matters on his mind - like dealing with a real-life bank raid. Ben Elton's comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and David Haig.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy falls for a narrowboat owner and resolves to leave home, but is surprised when Mother appears to be in favour. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor endures a sleepless night - and naturally ensures the eternally put-upon Margaret and their neighbours share in his suffering. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter.
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Beware of Laughing at Nora's Hats.
programme.desc: Alvin tries to persuade Nora Batty to go for a ride in his sidecar, but she's having none of it. When she relates the story of her long-standing feud with Audrey Craig - who had the audacity to laugh at her hat during a wedding many years ago - it becomes clear the broom-brandishing battleaxe is not one to be messed with.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful.
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys decides Arkwright needs a lesson in politeness, and convinces him a writer for the Good Shop Guide is doing the rounds. She then poses as the critic to see for herself the unusual sight of the miserly shopkeeper being nice to his customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy falls for a narrowboat owner and resolves to leave home, but is surprised when Mother appears to be in favour. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to improve the sale of an overstocked commodity with incredible efficiency, and Granville's lust for power leads to disaster. Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor endures a sleepless night - and naturally ensures the eternally put-upon Margaret and their neighbours share in his suffering. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter.
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Beware of Laughing at Nora's Hats.
programme.desc: Alvin tries to persuade Nora Batty to go for a ride in his sidecar, but she's having none of it. When she relates the story of her long-standing feud with Audrey Craig - who had the audacity to laugh at her hat during a wedding many years ago - it becomes clear the broom-brandishing battleaxe is not one to be messed with.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful.
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: In the first episode of the classic sitcom, beleaguered and badgered hotelier Basil Fawlty tries to attract a better class of clientele, but ends up being taken to the cleaners by the first seemingly upper-crust customer to check in. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom tries to market his garden produce, but finds it more difficult than he imagined - especially with the added pressure of paying the household rates. Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal star.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom's philosophy of life gains him two eager disciples - but he is soon anxious to be rid of them. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Rapid-fire comedy show, in which the Alcoholic Family has breakfast and Bob Fleming goes badger watching. Paul Whitehouse, Charlie Higson, Arabella Weir and Caroline Aherne star.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes becomes concerned when Dermot announces he wants to ask his childhood friend Buster, a known criminal, to be his best man. However, she is distracted when her neighbour Winnie's husband is rushed to hospital, leaving her son trying to raise funds for his wedding by getting embroiled in a money-making scheme.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jon Richardson, Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.
programme.desc: Jon Richardson, team captain on 8 Out of 10 Cats, hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, west London, warming up the crowd before introducing routines by fellow comedians Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy joins a band, but insists he is not going to be their roadie. Mark tries to forget Sophie by stalking shop assistant April - which results in him pretending to be signed up to the same history course as her. Offbeat comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Squalid students Vyvyan, Rick, Neil and Mike try to liven up a boring day with a trip to the pub, and have to contend with their landlord's insane nephew. Anarchic comedy, with special guests Madness starring alongside Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: La casa al final de la calle
La casa al final de la calle
Inside the PGA Tour
programme.desc: Players head to West Virginia to tee up at the historic Greenbrier Classic. Devastated by floods in 2016, the Greenbrier is now up and running thanks to the PGA TOUR family and countless other volunteers. Included: a look at the impact players like Bubba Watson had on the community, and remarks from the Governor of West Virginia, Jim Justice(n)

programme.title: Champions Tour Learning Center
programme.desc: Fred Couples joins host David Marr from the U.S. Senior Open with instruction on shot variances from short wedge distances. The World Golf Hall of Fame member uses a single club to demonstrate several different options in ball flight. Also: rookie Steve Flesch offers tips for playing from tightly mown runoff areas; and Billy Andrade introduces us to his passion away from the game when he goes clam digging(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including neck of lamb, rabbit, chorizo and rhubarb. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Charles Campion - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Remaining contestants Holly, Janet, Jo and Mary-Anne test their pastry-making skills in the next set of challenges. After serving mousse cake and iced fingers to judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, the cooks create a dough capable of being used in three types of pastry or croissant. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six more amateur cooks compete for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final. They prepare a plate of food that represents who they are as their calling card and choose one box of ingredients - either sweet or savoury - to rustle up a surprise dish in the invention test after John Torode demonstrates what he would do with the same produce. Two are then sent home, leaving the remaining four to serve dinner for Natalie Coleman, Dhruv Baker and James Nathan, MasterChef champions in 2013, 2010 and 2008 respectively, before Gregg Wallace and John decide which pair have made it through.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes from their favourite cookery books, explaining their value as social documents that reveal a great deal about people and what they ate. The duo meet Ivan Day, who has one of the most extensive collections of recipe books in the UK, and share stories of renowned food writers such as Elizabeth David and Isabella Beeton.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi travels to Majorca, the largest of Spain's Balearic Islands. He leaves the busy beaches behind as he heads inland in search of local cuisine and discovers a larder of local ingredients including roast suckling pig, tomatoes sweetened on the vine and oranges. He prepares a feast of Spanish and Moorish origin, featuring salt-crusted fish with fennel, a sweet and salty salad of caramelised oranges with goat's cheese and a dessert of apricots, almonds and raisins. He also discovers ruby red prawns in the coastal town of Soller, which become the key ingredient in his deconstructed paella.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part episode filmed in Tasmania, the MasterChef judge goes diving for the luxury seafood abalone, makes sushi and prepares a naval feast.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Remaining contestants Holly, Janet, Jo and Mary-Anne test their pastry-making skills in the next set of challenges. programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef serves up two different dishes using the same ingredients - one for children and one for adults - which are aimed at putting a stop to arguments at dinnertime and cater for busy families and fussy eaters.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish of their own invention using a selection of seven ingredients - including pork sausage, squash, Gorgonzola, walnuts and almonds. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw takes viewers on a culinary journey to Japan, beginning by discovering the delights of sea urchin, pond smelt and boutique cheesecake on the country's northern-most island Hokkaido.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining three hopefuls compete in the 2011 final, which sees them cooking for a street party attended by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, as well as friends, family and former Bake Off contestants. Their offerings include mille-feuille, mini Victoria sponges, and miniature strawberry and rhubarb cheesecakes. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult palate test, recreating John Torode's poached and fried pepper chicken, with herbed gnocchi, and mushroom and tarragon sauce, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. Can they identify the three types of mushroom in the recipe? They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic Jay Rayner, before finding out who has made it through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin visits his old catering college in Yorkshire, and recreates a selection of the classic puddings he learnt to make there. He challenges friend and fellow pupil Andrew Pern to a cooking competition, and later travels to the World Chocolate Masters to see some of the country's leading chocolatiers at work.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers forage for food, exploring Britain's fields and hedgerows in search of free ingredients that will form the basis of spectacular dishes.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi travels to the Greek island of Crete, which has a rich and complex culinary history with Turkey and north Africa as its neighbours. He travels to the capital Heraklion to make a variation of the Cretan dish meze dakos, consisting of tomatoes, crumbled feta, olives and oregano. In the fishing port of Agios Nikolaos he prepares octopus marinated in wine with baby squid stuffed with tomatoes and okra. Plus, on a trip inland, he uses feta for a cheesecake, and prepares a feast of spit-roasted pork souvlaki served with his twist on tzatziki.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MasterChef judge continues his culinary adventure in Tasmania, visiting a unique brewery and cattle farm, before feasting on fish and chips and a seafood salad.(n)

He challenges friend and fellow pupil Andrew Pern to a cooking competition, and later travels to the World Chocolate Masters to see some of the country's leading chocolatiers at work.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef shares more recipes as he prepares a selection of party food at his home in Hampshire, and offers tips on how to make quick and easy dishes that free him up to join in the fun.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi travels to the Greek island of Crete, which has a rich and complex culinary history with Turkey and north Africa as its neighbours. He travels to the capital Heraklion to make a variation of the Cretan dish meze dakos, consisting of tomatoes, crumbled feta, olives and oregano. In the fishing port of Agios Nikolaos he prepares octopus marinated in wine with baby squid stuffed with tomatoes and okra. Plus, on a trip inland, he uses feta for a cheesecake, and prepares a feast of spit-roasted pork souvlaki served with his twist on tzatziki.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MasterChef judge continues his culinary adventure in Tasmania, visiting a unique brewery and cattle farm, before feasting on fish and chips and a seafood salad.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining three hopefuls compete in the 2011 final, which sees them cooking for a street party attended by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, as well as friends, family and former Bake Off contestants. Their offerings include mille-feuille, mini Victoria sponges, and miniature strawberry and rhubarb cheesecakes. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult palate test, recreating John Torode's poached and fried pepper chicken, with herbed gnocchi, and mushroom and tarragon sauce, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. Can they identify the three types of mushroom in the recipe? They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic Jay Rayner, before finding out who has made it through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish of their own invention using a selection of seven ingredients - including pork sausage, squash, Gorgonzola, walnuts and almonds. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.desc: Princess Mia settles in Genovia, but is required to be wed before she can assume the crown of her country. Her grandmother urges her to follow through on an arranged marriage(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, the illusionists known as the Four Horsemen (Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Lizzy Caplan, and Dave Franco) return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their names and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul named Walter Mabry (Daniel Radcliffe). However, Mabry soon turns the tables, and forces the group to steal a revolutionary decrypting device for him. Directed by Jon M. Chu (G.I. Joe: Retaliation)(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Nick Marshall, Playboy and hot shot in advertising, thinks he's God's gift to women. After an accident however, he discovers that he is suddenly able to her what women really think. Nick decides to sabotage his new boss by reading her thoughts and selling her ideas as his own, but unfortunately love gets in his way(n)

programme.title: Nights in Rodanthe
programme.desc: A doctor is en route to reconcile with his estranged son when his benevolent mission is sidelined upon checking into a North Carolina beach-town inn. When the doctor arrives at the inn, he enters into a passionate affair with an unhappily married woman who is currently considering divorce. Network Television Premiere(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: Steven Soderbergh's remake of the classic Andrei Torkovsky film stars George Clooney as the therapist sent to mentor a group of astronauts on the Prometheus space station, where the remaining crew are both locked in their own fears, speaking of visions of lost loved ones. At first sceptical, when Clooney's lost wife appears to him, he begins to wonder what influence the mysterious planet Solaris has on the human psyche(n)

programme.desc: When Kate dies in a bizarre accident on her wedding day, her spirit lingers, determined to stop her grieving fiancé from moving on(n)

programme.desc: A cop is on a mission to avenge the death of his partner, but his investigations expose corruption and greed and soon both gangsters and police target him. Action(n)

programme.title: Soul Food
programme.desc: Warm and touching family drama centred around a plentifully stocked dinner table. Mamma Joe, the matriarch of an extended African American family, lays on famous Sunday 'soul food' feasts at which the family come together and resolve their differences. However, when Mamma Joe falls ill the family begins to fracture, leaving one young man, Ahmad - through whose eyes the story is told - trying to keep the relatives from descending into all-out war(n)

programme.title: Tashi and the Monk
programme.desc: A visit to a home for orphans and abandoned children in northeastern India that was founded by a former Buddhist monk, who's reminded of his own troubled childhood by an unruly new arrival(n)

programme.desc: Baltimore journalists Dan and Lorie give accounts of their love affair and subsequent break-up on a TV talk-show(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: Wartime drama about a young man who is taught medicine by the doctor at the orphanage where he was brought up. When he clashes with his mentor over the issue of abortion, he leaves the home and finds work on a cider farm. There he falls in love with another man's girlfriend, but starts to re-evaluate his principles when one of the farm workers becomes pregnant by her own father(n)

programme.desc: Powerful, Oscar-winning biopic of Ron Kovic, a patriotic all-American boy who returned from the war in Vietnam with horrific injuries and became a committed anti-war campaigner. programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: Wartime drama about a young man who is taught medicine by the doctor at the orphanage where he was brought up. When he clashes with his mentor over the issue of abortion, he leaves the home and finds work on a cider farm. There he falls in love with another man's girlfriend, but starts to re-evaluate his principles when one of the farm workers becomes pregnant by her own father(n)

programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: A priest's visions bring FBI agents Mulder and Scully back together for an investigation involving the mysterious disappearance of a group of women(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: Self-centred TV talkshow host Roscoe goes home to Georgia, where he's put back in his place(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A divorced woman and her diabetic daughter take refuge in their newly-purchased house's safe room, when three men break-in, searching for a missing fortune(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 160. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Compelling biography of the titular young singing star whose career was cut tragically short by her murder. Jennifer Lopez stars in the lead role, with Edward James Olmos as her father(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Docudrama about two young arms dealers who win a $300 million contract to supply weaponry to US forces in Afghanistan(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: An English teenager dreams of soccer stardom, against the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert
programme.desc: Fans of Miley Cyrus and her pop-star alter ego on her series Hannah Montana get the best of both worlds with this live concert film. Shot during her 54-city musical tour, this concert captures Cyrus performing both as herself and as Hannah. She perform a handful of song with The Jonas Brothers. THe directors also include footage of the performers backstage. The film is presented in Disney Digital 3-D, providing the most realistic concert experience possible(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Tom Stoppard provided the witty and intelligent script for John Madden's romantic comedy in which young Will Shakespeare struggles with writer's block and money worries while trying to complete Romeo and Ethel: The Pirate's Daughter. Gwyneth Paltrow once more employs her faultless English accent, playing aristocratic Viola de Lesseps, who is shortly to be married off but yearns to slum it as an actor. Disguising herself as a boy in order to be allowed on stage, Viola becomes Will's muse, and the more familiar tale of Romeo and Juliet begins to take shape as the couple fall passionately in love. The film is littered with knowing lines and energetically supported by a stellar cast, including Judy Dench as Queen Elizabeth - a cameo performance which earned her one of the movie's seven Oscars(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: C.S. Lewis's beloved fantasy novels come to life in this enchanting adventure. Dazzling special effects highlight the story of four British children who enter a magical world, where they befriend wondrous creatures and battle a witch (Tilda Swinton). Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, William Moseley, Anna Popplewell. Directed by Andrew Adamson(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry in this intense thriller. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Unfaithful
programme.desc: When a suburban wife meets a Manhattan book dealer and begins an affair, her husband begins to suspect something and hires a detective. Soon learning the truth, the husband takes matters into his own hands and decides to confront his wife's lover(n)

programme.desc: Sinclair Broadcast Group. The Sinclair Broadcast Group and its ownership of local U.S. television stations; and Donald Trump's tweets about Mika Brzezinski are discussed(n)

programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. The film is littered with knowing lines and energetically supported by a stellar cast, including Judy Dench as Queen Elizabeth - a cameo performance which earned her one of the movie's seven Oscars(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorite figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake (Asa Butterfield) follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. Eva Green, Samuel L. Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. Directed by Tim Burton, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children was adapted from Ransom Riggs' debut novel of the same name(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Donna, an independent, single mother who owns a small hotel on an idyllic Greek island, is about to let go of Sophie, the spirited daughter she's raised alone. For Sophie's wedding, Donna has invited her two lifelong best girlfriends--practical and no-nonsense Rosie and wealthy, multi-divorcee Tonya--from her one-time backing band, Donna and the Dynamos. But Sophie has secretly invited three guests of her own(n)

programme.title: Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted
programme.desc: Comedian Tig Notaro performs at the Wilbur Theatre in Boston. Topics include doing shows in Las Vegas; introducing her fiancée to her family in Mississippi; TSA screenings; small planes; Santa Claus; and misleading text messages. Taped May 31, 2015(n)

programme.title: Off Air
programme.desc: Off Air(n)

Greetings card writer Tom falls for his boss's new assistant, who claims she doesn't believe in love. Throughout the next 500 days Tom experiences the highs and lows of their coming together and falling apart(n)

programme.title: The Strange History of Don't Ask, Don't Tell
programme.desc: A look at the U.S. armed forces' ban on gays and lesbians includes remarks from activists, politicians, and active and former service members; and a timeline of the contentious process leading up to the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell, which takes effect on Sept. 20, 2011, and allows homosexuals to serve openly for the first time. Directed by Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: This thrilling adventure yarn finds an older and wiser Tarzan returning to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England. There, he clashes with a greedy Belgian captain who has sinister plans for his old home(n)

programme.desc: Sinclair Broadcast Group. The Sinclair Broadcast Group and its ownership of local U.S. television stations; and Donald Trump's tweets about Mika Brzezinski are discussed(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
programme.desc: Dave Attell. Dave Attell performs a set from San Francisco. Among other things, he talks about trash trucks, cable TV, and when men know they're going bald ("your conversations with your barber keep getting shorter")(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: This fun-loving romantic comedy follows a young New Yorker (Alexis Bledel) as she searches for the perfect man. A Wall Street big shot (Scott Porter) seems like the real deal, until she meets his handsome coworker (Bryan Greenberg) and comes to realize love is as big of a gamble as the stock market(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: A feisty television producer is torn between an ambitious yet dim anchorman and her closest confidant, a cynical veteran reporter(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie," a 2016 adaptation of the popular British sitcom about hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy, who flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. The film stars Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, and is directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
programme.desc: The troll who menaced a community returns generations later to harrass the last surviving descendant, village idiot Ernest P Worrell. Comedy for the kids(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A witty script and a great ensemble cast add up to one of Woody Allen's most hilarious farces. Allen wrote, directed and stars as a washed-up filmmaker who is suddenly stricken with psychosomatic blindness on the eve of his big comeback(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Lew Schneider. Lew Schneider comments on New York City, appliances, marriage, parenthood and religion. Taped in Miami Beach(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer and Cher star in this Oscar nominated comedy as three bored, single women who dream of a man that can satisfy their desires. But when a filthy rich, mysterious man arrives in their lives, things start to get interesting(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: Two Puerto Rican NYC cops (Luis Guzman and Edgar Garcia) are asked by a pair of French fashion designers (Alice Taglioni and Frederic Anscombre) to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag. Rosie Perez and Rosario Dawson co-star. Directed by Ian Edelman(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: While Christmas shopping in New York for their respective partners, Jonathan and Sara meet by chance and fall in love before the day is over. At the end of the evening, Sara jumps in a cab and leaves, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed bring them back together and they rekindle their love(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Director Amy Heckerling's hilarious teen movie follows brother and sister Brad and Stacy through a world of dead-end jobs, uninspiring classes, borrowed cars and sexual anxiety. Sean Penn is unforgettable as a stoned surfer(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Academy Award-winner Renee Zellweger returns as Bridget Jones, the loveable Brit who looks for love and happiness with her inimitable frank and self-effacing style. This follow up to the international smash hit Bridget Jones' Diary, picks up four weeks later as Bridget already begins to question her romance with the ultra-conservative Marc Darcy. Superstar Hugh Grant also returns as Bridget's wild playboy boss. Just when you thought the hilarious romantic entanglements were over! This is a spirited, intelligent comedy that will please audiences on either side of the pond(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Traditionally, angels are supposed to have snowy wings, spotless flowing robes and be bathed in heavenly light, but not Michael (John Travolta). With a hairy pot belly, long hair, a cigarette addiction, an insatiable sugar craving and filthy wings, the archangel Michael is anything but angelic looking. His unkempt appearance and the fact that he is found holed up in a ramshackle boarding house in a beat-up Iowa backwater, makes it even harder to believe that he is anything but a bum. Still when the publisher of the National Mirror, the country's top tabloid learns there may be an angel afoot, he sends three reporters out to cover the story. Slightly embittered writer Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) hopes the story will bust him out of his slump. Hapless photographer Huey (Robert Pastorelli) worries that one more botched job will cause publisher Vartan Malt (Bob Hoskins) to take away his one lucrative gig shooting celebrity wonder-dog Sparky. The enigmatic Dorothy (Andie MacDowell) is supposedly an expert on all things angelic. Together the disparate trio travel to Iowa and meet Pansy Millbank (Jean Stapleton) the aged owner of a run-down rooming house who tells them how Michael miraculously saved her from financial ruin. In return, she allows him to stay at her place. Naturally, the reporters want to meet this phenomenon, but they are ill-prepared at what groggily stumps down the stairs to greet them. From the stubble-faced, boxer-short wearing, smouldering mess before them, they learn that all high-ranking angels are allowed 26 Earthly vacations for all eternity. This is Michael's final vacation and he wants to have fun. The reporters only want to get as much publicity as they can from their ethereal visitor and so set off with him to Chicago. Along the way, they have many funny misadventures(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his friend decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various hit movies(n)

programme.title: The Winning Season
programme.desc: A man (Sam Rockwell) attempts to pull his life together by teaching his daughter's (Emma Roberts) high-school basketball team in this indie comedy by Grace Is Gone writer/director James C. Strouse. Rob Corddry co-stars in this Gigi/Plum Pictures production(n)

programme.title: Grumpier Old Men
programme.desc: 1995. Odd couple Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau are reunited for this curmudgeonly comedy sequel. Two Italian women plan to turn the old guys' bait shop into a restaurant. Dir: Lorant Deutch(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Zany horror spoof about a talented brain surgeon trapped in marriage to a malicious wife whose affections are shared with everyone but her husband. A serial elevator killer is on the loose, and the good doctor finds himself in love with the disembodied brain of one of the killer's victims. All he needs is a body to put it in(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Takeoff on the Godfather with the son of a mafia king taking over for his dying father(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Docudrama about two young arms dealers who win a $300 million contract to supply weaponry to US forces in Afghanistan(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Semi-autobiographical tale from Spike Lee based on his childhood growing up in 70s New York. Young Troy watches her parents fight over money, and gets a chance to see how the other half lives when she visits wealthy cousins in the country(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Sick of being bullied by her overpowering Greek family, dowdy Toula signs up for college. Despite every warning, Toula falls for a non-Greek guy, but it's not easy getting her clan to accept him(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2

programme.title: Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas
programme.desc: The legendary rogue of the seven seas confronts a new assortment of dangers and thrills in this animated action-adventure tale. Sinbad (voice of Brad Pitt) and his crews of pirate adventurers are hoping to retire to Fiji, and they discover a treasure that could make that possible -- the Book of Peace, which has kept the Twelve Cities in harmony for centuries. But Sinbad's plan to snatch the magic book is complicated when he learns it's on board a ship captained by his longtime friend Proteus (voice of Joseph Fiennes). While Sinbad still has his eye on the book, so does the mischievous goddess Eris (voice of Michelle Pfeifer), who sends a deadly sea monster into Sinbad's path to scuttle his plans. With the help of Proteus, Sinbad prevails over the beast, and determined Eris responds by snatching the book and framing Sinbad for the crime. Noble Proteus offers to step in for Sinbad and take his punishment, so now the adventurer has ten days to rescue the book from Eris or Proteus will pay with his life. While Sinbad is at first uncertain if he should take on such a dangerous assignment or simply high-tail it to Fiji, someone is on hand to persuade him -- Marina (voice of Catherine Zeta-Jones), Proteus' lovely but hard-headed fiancée, who has stowed away on Sinbad's ship. Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas was the first animated feature written by John Logan, who received an Oscar nomination for his script for Gladiator(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth

His 13-year-old nephew (Josh Hutcherson) and a pretty Icelandic mountaineer (Anita Briem) round out the search party. Seth Meyers, Jean Michel Pare, Jane Wheeler(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: When Egyptian-born chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi mysteriously vanishes on a routine flight from South Africa to Washington, his wife, Isabella, embarks on a frantic international search for her missing husband. At the same time, a CIA analyst arrives at a clandestine detention facility outside of United States. As the interrogation of El-Ibrahimi gets under way, the CIA analyst is profoundly shaken by the unorthodox methods used by the man's captors, and quickly begins to reevaluate his assignment(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she is forced to move in with a long-suffering employee of hers (Kristen Bell), and tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Friendship becomes rivalry and the quest for fame becomes obsession in the virile epic produced in part by Ridley Scott and featuring gripping portrayals by Academy Award nominees Brad Pitt as Jesse and Casey Affleck as the youth drawn closer to his goal ... and farther from his own humanity. Everyone in 1880's America knows Jesse James. He's the nation's most notorious criminal, hunted by the law in 10 states. He's also the land's greatest hero, lauded as a Robin Hood by the public. Robert Ford? No one knows him. Not yet. But the ambitious 19 year old aims to change that. He'll befriend Jesse, ride with his gang. And if that doesn't bring Ford fame, he'll find a deadlier way(n)

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: James Belushi and Charles Grodin team up for this variation on the Prince and the Pauper. Belushi plays Jimmy Dworski, a convicted car thief, serving time in a minimum security prison. But when Jimmy wins a pair of tickets to the World Series from a radio call-in show, he can't resist walking out of jail, particularly when the warden won't even let the inmates watch the series on television. Grodin plays rich workaholic Spencer Barnes, who, when his wife walks out on him right before a long-planned vacation, leaves his datebook in an airport telephone booth. Happening upon Spencer's datebook is Jimmy, who simply intends to return the datebook to Spencer for a 1,000-dollar reward. But when he finds the datebook contains his credit cards, Jimmy assumes Spencer's identity, living the good life and dating the boss's daughter, while making his way to Malibu to return the property to Spencer(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Enterprising teenager Joel Goodsen turns his parents' house into a brothel when they go out of town on a trip(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: The body count and the laughs are close to equal (and there are a ton of both) in this slam-bang actioner about a heavily armed, mysterious loner (Clive Owen) who protects a newborn baby from hit men doing the dirty work of a loopy villain (Paul Giamatti) who's dying to get his hands on the infant. Monica Bellucci costars as a heart-of-gold hooker who helps Owens. Written and directed by Michael Davis(n)

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: A mercenary risks his life when he agrees to escort a mysterious young woman with a deadly secret from post-apocalyptic Eastern Europe to New York City(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Tom Cruise returns as both producer and agent Ethan Hunt in his second action-adventure adaptation of the television series. Directed by John Woo, the action speeds across the continents, as Ethan accepts his latest mission retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically modified disease called Chimera, as well as recover the cure, Bellerophon, which is currently in the hands of a group of terrorists led by Sean Ambrose. For the mission to succeed, Ethan must persuade jewel thief Nyah Hall to join him, which he does by nearly running her car off a cliff! But, when Nyah becomes infected with the disease, Ethan must battle to save the woman he loves, even if that means sending her into enemy territory, and the hands of her ex-boyfriend. Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Comedy about a born fighter who is thrown out of the army and winds up training a group of junior cadets. In desperation, the fearsome Payne finds a civilian job teaching combat skills to a mixed bunch of kids at a private school - and the results are hilarious!(n)

programme.title: Criminal

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: 1992 blockbuster starring Whitney Houston and Kevin Costner - as a singer superstar and her bodyguard who fall in love. Houston hires Costner when she starts receiving death threats from a stalker. The ex-presidential bodyguard has a past, however. He is wracked by guilt over his inability to protect Reagan from John Hinckley's assassination attempt. He's certainly not going to let a bullet slip past himagain and the draconian security measures he sets up are a shock to Houston. But Costner proves his worth when, in the face of death threats, the singer gives the performance of her life at the Oscar ceremony. Houston brings the house down with her performance of the Dolly Parton song 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

programme.desc: Tracker Joe Kidd is hired by vengeful rancher Harlan to lead his hunters to a Mexican bandit. But when Kidd sees Harlan's viciousness in action, he switches sides. Western famous for the scene in which Clint drives a train through a town(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: This feel-good ensemble comedy tracks a quartet of suburban siblings and their families over the course of a single summer. Hardworking Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his stay-at-home wife, Karen (Mary Steeenburgen), have just a few months to help their oldest son, Kevin (Jasen Fisher), overcome his high-strung behavior problems before he'll be relegated to special-education classes. Gil's difficult relationship with his own father, Frank (Jason Robards), has led him to become a would-be super-dad for his three kids, so he takes his son's difficulties more than a little personally. Gil's sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is trying to raise a moody, adolescent son (Leaf Phoenix) and an independent-minded daughter (Martha Plimpton) with no help from her well-off ex-husband, who's more interested in his new wife and family. Gil and Helen's sister, Susan (Harley Jane Kozak), meanwhile, must participate in the too-scripted Big Life Plans of her anal-retentive husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), whose overachiever zeal infects even their toddler daughter. When long-lost brother Larry (Tom Hulce) show up with yet another get-rich-quick scheme, he brings with him a surprise addition to the family. Screenwriters Babaloo Mandel, Lowell Ganz, and Ron Howard negotiate their varied subplots with a deftness and comedic touch that transforms this conflicted clan into a suburban everyfamily(n)

programme.title: Soul Food
programme.desc: Warm and touching family drama centred around a plentifully stocked dinner table. Mamma Joe, the matriarch of an extended African American family, lays on famous Sunday 'soul food' feasts at which the family come together and resolve their differences. However, when Mamma Joe falls ill the family begins to fracture, leaving one young man, Ahmad - through whose eyes the story is told - trying to keep the relatives from descending into all-out war(n)

programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Goes Back to School
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Goes Back to School. Season Two of Monk begins as television's favorite obsessive-compulsive detective (Tony Shalhoub) hires on as a substitute teacher at Ashton High School. This enables him to investigate the death of English teacher Beth Landow (Erica Yoder), who fell from the school's clock tower while most of the students were taking a Saturday-morning SAT exam. Principal Arlene Cassidy (Rosalind Chao) doesn't buy the official theory that Beth committed suicide--and neither does Monk, once he's perused certain bits of evidence overlooked by the police (including a suicide note filled with grammatical errors). In a further complication, the Most Likely Suspect has an airtight alibi: He was proctoring the SATs in full view of a roomful of students at the time Beth fell! With this episode, Kane Ritchotte returns to the role of Benjy Fleming, the son of Monk's loyal nurse-assistant Sharona Fleming (Bitty Schram)(n)

Edward Furlong is Geoff, the new kid in a small Maine town, whose veterinarian father has relocated after the death of his wife. After a friend's dog is killed, Geoff and the boy discover and make use of a 'sematary' with the power to reanimate the dead. It isn't long before dead people are placed in the special soil and the boys have some true, gory problems on their hands(n)

programme.title: House of Wax
programme.desc: A bunch of college students are stranded in a small town where suffering for art takes on a whole new meaning in this tale of terror. Carly (Elisha Cuthbert) and her boyfriend, Wade (Jared Padalecki), have hit the road with a handful of their friends to attend a championship college football game; tagging along with them are Carly's bratty friend Paige (Paris Hilton, Carly's trouble-making twin brother Nick (Chad Michael Murray), and Blake (Robert Ri'chard), Paige's latest boy toy. While camping out for the night, the gang makes the mistake of getting on the wrong side of a mysterious local redneck, and the next morning they discover that Wade's car no longer works. As the others continue on to the big game, Carly and Wade make their way into the closest town, Ambrose, and discover it's all but deserted, except for a local tourist attraction, the House of Wax. However, it isn't long before they find out why the wax sculptures at the museum look so freakishly real, and discover a pair of murderous brothers are keen on making them part of the next exhibit. House of Wax is an in-name-only remake of the well-remembered 1953 3-D horror outing starring Vincent Price, which was in turn based on the 1933 picture Mystery of the Wax Museum(n)

In each round, host David Dickinson details the history and provenance of three objects, but is only telling the truth about one, leaving the teams to identify the valuable item.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against quiz expert the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Lawrence tries to mask his guilt, while Megan suggests a family meal at the pub, leaving Frank delighted, until Tracy confronts him beforehand. Cain and Harriet come to an agreement.(n)

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Fire: How Safe Are Our High-Rises? Tonight.
programme.desc: Cladding from scores of high-rise flats across the UK has failed fire safety tests ordered after the Grenfell Tower tragedy. But many other buildings - including hotels and student accommodation - have also been caught up in a crisis that could cost billions. Adam Shaw investigates.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: The broadcaster meets Florida woman Jennifer Mee who, as a teenager, became a media sensation when she suffered a particularly strange ailment - a persistent case of hiccups. But in 2010, she lured an innocent man to a dark alleyway where her friends were waiting to rob him. Instead he ended up being shot dead. Even though she didn't pull the trigger, and was nowhere near when the bullets were fired, Jennifer was sentenced to life without parole. Piers charts the journey through fame and rejection that saw Jennifer descend into a criminal lifestyle, and asks family members and legal experts if they believe her punishment was too harsh.(n)

programme.title: Fearless
programme.desc: As Kevin's trial continues, the forensics seem to be proving his innocence and leading to an acquittal after 14 years, but the prosecution delivers a persuasive counter argument. With Heather and Sir Alastair keen to bring the case to a close, will Kevin accept a plea of manslaughter to secure his freedom? Meanwhile, Yusef Attar sends word that he is in the UK and wants to meet Emma, who travels to Birmingham to see him, tracked by Olivia Greenwood. Thriller, starring Helen McCrory and Michael Gambon.(n)

programme.desc: Lady Southwold, Lady Marjorie's widowed mother, and her companion Miss Hodges arrive, throwing the household into turmoil. Later, the staff below stairs are dismayed to hear that a brooch has apparently been stolen.(n)

programme.desc: The team battles to save two youngsters with gunshot wounds. Stuart is haunted by a promise he makes to a dying man. To Mike's surprise, Cathy announces she is leaving. Christine makes a decision about her future.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. Tragedy looms as Andrew is swept away while trying to save an injured man from a fast-flowing river, giving Sam the opportunity to become the hero of the hour. programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth joins the suffragette movement and plans a raid on a local MP's house, but it is Rose who is arrested during the ensuing scuffle and sent to Holloway Prison.(n)

programme.desc: Robert shocks his partner Issy by revealing that he's prepared to pack in work to help look after their new baby, while in her boss's absence, Christine's professional judgement is tested when a burns victim faces almost certain death. With Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth heads to Lake Windermere for a holiday with faithful assistant Hastings, only to find his crime-solving skills are once again needed to investigate a murder. The only witness to the crime is a dog, leaving Poirot with a difficult task to find the killer. David Suchet stars, with Kate Buffery, Patrick Ryecart and Julia St John.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Hardy and Ellie appeal to Trish to be more open with them as she may have information that - although not related to the attack - could help the investigation, but she is unwilling to co-operate. The officers of Broadchurch CID are slowly making their way through the painstaking process of interviewing witnesses and collecting statements and start to uncover inconsistencies and lies - and previously hidden connections between Trish and some suspects. Crime drama, with David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspect's property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and it's clear he wasn't the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his father's retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The village prepares for Nick and Teresa's wedding as the Battle of Britain draws to an end. Pat faces a big decision as Marek prepares to leave, but Bob intends to ruin her plans. Frances fights to clear her name following the closure of the factory, Alison wrestles with her conscience, and a chance encounter leaves Joyce with some unanswered questions. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When a spate of petty thefts culminates in a series of murders at a student hostel, the Belgian sleuth is called in to investigate. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Philip Jackson, Pauline Moran, Damian Lewis and Paris Jefferson.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Jane Preston and DS Ben Shaw investigate when homeowner Ray Carroll attacks a burglar inside his property, and ends up putting the perpetrator in hospital. However, it comes to light that the supposed criminal has a history with Ray, and this is not the first time he has been left needing medical treatment. The detectives soon suspect there is more to the story than the Carroll family is letting on. Drama, guest starring Louis Emerick (Brookside), Tricia Penrose (Heartbeat) and Bill Ward (Coronation Street).(n)

Starring Gary Mavers, Joseph Millson and Haydn Gwynne.(n)

programme.desc: Blaketon is eager to halt a crimewave before the Assistant Chief Constable arrives for a shoot on Lord Ashfordly's estate, while Kate is faced with a medical and moral dilemma. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.desc: Elizabeth embarks upon an affair with influential Armenian Julius Karekin, who buys her a hat shop - but his former mistress seems intent on causing mischief. Donald Burton guest stars, with Nicola Pagett, Gordon Jackson and Jean Marsh.(n)

programme.desc: As Robert becomes increasingly engrossed in his domestic life, rumours abound that he's considering retirement - but his professional responsibilities must come first when the department is contaminated by a mystery substance. And just when it looks like things have been brought more or less under control, Christine delivers a bombshell. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and David Harewood.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth has retired to a charming English village in the hope of finding peace and quiet. However, the murder of a rich industrialist neighbour forces him to leave his new lifestyle behind as he plunges into a sordid world of blackmail and envy, aided by the dogged Chief Inspector Japp. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Malcolm Terris and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley).(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel meets Sean's son, who turns out to be an eight-year-old version of his dad, and the idea of becoming a stepmum puts her further off the idea of marriage than she was before - not that she even agreed in the first place. Andy asks Janet out for a drink, but when she turns him down he accuses her of leading him on. A woman in a sexy cop's uniform turns up dead, and the DCI assumes the killer was her lover - the question is, which one of her many lovers was it? And to add to the mystery, why was her face painted green?.(n)

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: New series. Fact-based crime drama about the fatal shooting of 11-year-old Rhys Jones as he walked home from football practice in Croxteth, Liverpool, caught in the crossfire of a feud between rival gangs. Detective Superintendent Dave Kelly is charged with bringing his teenage killer to justice, but thought the assailant's identity is well known, finding the evidence to charge him proves to be a far more difficult challenge. Stephen Graham stars.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators visit Houston, where a family have discovered poisoned meat left for their pet dogs in their garden.(n)

programme.desc: A deadly disease breaks out in the institution's stable block, threatening the lives of all the horses in it.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary investigating the case of Toni Lee Sharpless a nurse and mother with a bipolar disorder who vanished in August 2009 after a night out in Gladwyne, Pennsylvania. programme.desc: The case of TV producer Bruce Beresford-Redmond, who killed his wife while on holiday. Plus, the California city that nearly wentes bankrupt as the victim of a corruption scandal.(n)

programme.desc: The German impostor and killer who masqueraded as an heir to the fabled Rockefeller fortune. He thought getting away with murder was his final con, but events proved him wrong.(n)

programme.desc: Courtroom programme featuring prominent US legal commentator and former District Attorney and County Judge Jeanine Pirro as the presiding jurist.(n)

programme.desc: FBI agents track down bank robbers and a desperate fugitive who plundered thousands of dollars and started a crime wave.(n)

programme.desc: Detective Joey Catalanotto recalls a case in which a 20-year-old was gunned down for the contents of her purse. A lack of physical evidence meant it was particularly difficult to track down the culprit.(n)

programme.title: Six Degrees of Murder
programme.desc: The murder of New England handyman Jack Reid in June 2005. Two men eventually confessed to helping kill Reid, claiming millionaire John Brooks paid them to ambush him in a barn, where they said Brooks helped beat the victim to death with a hammer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police investigate two crimes of passion, one featuring a man who was shot dead in his home, and another in which a football player and his girlfriend were beaten to death.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How cutting-edge technology is being used to solve murder cases more than a decade old, with a look at the kinds of information detectives search for when fresh clues are scarce.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: A case from Orlando in which a woman vanished in broad daylight, before her naked body was found dumped in woods a few days later.(n)

programme.title: Who Killed Jane Doe
programme.desc: A case in which a young woman's scorched body was found in the Arizona desert. The investigation into her death would take decades to reveal her name and her killer.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: Killings where the bodies were located in swampland, principally due to the perpetrators believing such terrain helps conceal vital evidence against them.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Timothy Moore, whose body was found in a shallow grave in April 2011, five months after he had been reported missing from his home in Washington's Willapa Bay. His son Devon later pleaded guilty to his murder.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.(n)

programme.title: Murder Calls
programme.desc: The emergency call, missing phone, mystery man and surprising forensic clues that turned a seemingly obvious suicide investigation into a homicide case.(n)

programme.title: I Am Homicide
programme.desc: Detective McFadden recalls a deadly robbery at a fast food joint, in which he found the victim was targeted for execution - and uncovered a surprising emotional connection.(n)

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: Retired homicide detective Chris Anderson and Los Angeles-based criminal defence attorney Melissa Lewkowicz revisit the case of lady's man, hustler and cult leader Freddie Freeman, suspected of the cold-blooded murder of a Michigan mayor.(n)

programme.desc: As the case unfolded, critical investigative mistakes were made. However, potential suspects were introduced, including a Santa impersonator and a known sex offender.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Assistant Chief investigator Charles Jantzen tries to save 70 cats and dogs from a run-down private animal rescue centre.(n)

programme.desc: The case of 28-year-old Jeremy Alex, who was last seen in April 2004 running towards a house in Northport, Maine claiming that the `bad guys' were after him.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: The story of Kwame Kilpatrick, the youngest mayor of Detroit and the biggest hope for the dying city. He ended up in prison after being convicted on felony counts.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: The crimes of Joran van der Sloot. The Dutchman was convicted of murdering Stephany Flores Ramirez in Lima, Peru, and is the primary suspect in the 2005 disappearance of Natalee Holloway in Aruba. After Flores Ramirez's murder in May 2010, van der Sloot fled to Chile where he was arrested and extradited back to face charges.(n)

programme.title: Judge Jeanine Pirro
programme.desc: Courtroom programme featuring prominent US legal commentator and former District Attorney and County Judge Jeanine Pirro as the presiding jurist.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears from a small community, and a massive media campaign proves successful in tracking down a serial killer.(n)

programme.title: The Detectives Club: New Orleans
programme.desc: The case of a man murdered in his New Orleans home. `Digital breadcrumbs' eventually led Detective Barret Morton to a cold-blooded killer with a deadly jealous streak.(n)

programme.title: Six Degrees of Murder
programme.desc: The case of 26-year-old mother-of-three Christine Sheddy, who was killed in November 2007 near Pocomoke City, Maryland, and had been considered a missing person for more than two years before a tip-off led police to her remains.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists reconstruct the scene of a bludgeoning in Georgia, USA, in an attempt to track down the suspect in a murder investigation.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Using forensics to solve murders and uncover sinister plots within families.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of North Dakota student Dru Sjodin, who vanished in November 2003. CCTV footage showed Dru's last movements revealing the chilling reason for her disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The 1992 murder of Debbie Fagan, who was shot while inside her car, in Monrovia, Maryland. The mother-of-two's estranged husband was later found guilty of the crime.(n)

programme.title: Who Killed Jane Doe
programme.desc: The case of Pamela Knight, who in 2005 vanished on her youngest son's birthday. Seven years later, two men found her remains buried under an abandoned shed. It transpired her husband, Paul Anthony Knight, had killed her and hidden her body before disappearing himself.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The case of Beverly Jackson, whose body was found in a car pulled from a canal. Police explored her relationships, but it required the involvement of a hotline tipster to track down her killer.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 66-year-old Sharron Erickson, who was raped and murdered in the small Midwestern town of Colon, Nebraska in June 2003. James Marrs, who lived just 75 feet away, was later found guilty of the crime.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.(n)

programme.title: Married with Secrets
programme.desc: The disappearance of an aspiring kindergarten teacher in Ireland. Her relatives believed depression had driven her to suicide - but in reality a twisted BDSM master was involved.(n)
