programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps a Nottinghamshire couple search for a new house with enough land for them to set up a luxury camping business in Andalucia, southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B veteran Paul Workman, who runs Hamlet House in Stratford-upon-Avon, makes the most of his town's Shakespeare connection as another round of the competition gets under way - but his guests cause a fuss when a hair is found in the mushrooms at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to B&B novices Ben Gray and Katie Keegan's Ashlack business in Cumbria. The guests admire rooms in the estate's 17th-century manor house, but Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud are unimpressed when they discover their accommodation is a yurt in the woods. Filled with dread at the idea of a midnight trip to the toilet facilities, they later make plain their feelings when checking out.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Richwood in Torquay, where partners Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud run the 13-bedroom guest house by themselves. The diners are given a crash course in belly-dancing and provided with a feast of Lebanese delicacies - but are soon distracted by the dated decor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Helen Fraser welcomes her guests to the Tai'r Bull Inn in the Brecon Beacons, with moral support from her friend Kath. Ben and Katie are quick to praise the quality of their lodgings, but B&B veteran Paul spots a few mistakes, while Saida and Veronica refuse to spend the night in their room after they make a discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. A clash then ensues between two of the week's hosts before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi tries to help Sheffield couple Chris and Lynn Simmerson find their ideal retirement home on Spain's Costa Blanca and discovers their £80,000 budget stretches further than expected.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Sara Damergi helps Mark Shaw and Wlan Amorim from London search for their ideal holiday home in the historical centre of Valencia - one of Spain's biggest cities. The pair have a budget of £100,000 and chef Wlan is unable to compromise on the size of the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts visit the Naval College and Maritime Museum in Greenwich, which stands on the site of Henry VIII's favourite palace. They have just three days to locate the missing jousting yard, where the king indulged his love of the sport, and the armoury - offering Phil Harding the chance to model some authentic protective equipment of the time.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on another excavation, searching for Liberty's first silk factory in south London. The archaeologists try to re-create the 19th-century techniques of dyeing and printing that would have been used - and the frustrating dig finally yields results on the last day.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Hampshire to repair a VW Golf GTI Mk1 that has been kept in a garage since a road accident in 2001. However, they both have different ideas about how the finished car should look when it is returned to its owner.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman and her sons bring in their springer spaniel puppy for complicated surgery on its badly deformed hind leg. Meanwhile, the owner of an eight-year-old cocker spaniel waits to hear if her dog's cancer has spread, and the vet treats a two-year-old cat, which is dragging one of its back legs.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman who suffers from nocturnal epileptic fits brings in Pearl, a Staffordshire Bull Terrier that can sense when her episodes are about to happen. However, the dog has problems with its knees and struggles to walk, so the pressure is on for Professor Noel Fitzpatrick to restore it back to full health. Plus, an Irish Setter has a cancerous tumour in its front leg, and a cat needs its jaw wiring back together after being hit by a car.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Architect Henning Stummel and his partner Alice Dawson plan to convert a dilapidated joinery workshop in north London into a contemporary family home and office. They want to preserve the building's original steel frame, but to restore it they will have to take it down, which means carefully extracting it from the neighbours' walls without causing damage to their property - and that's just the start of the couple's problems. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: A couple who have given themselves just two weeks to construct their new home in beachside Maianbar, south of Sydney, despite the fact that they have never built anything before.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Sleep
programme.desc: A 36-year-old who has finally received a diagnosis of narcolepsy and a 20-year-old whose horrifying night terrors are keeping her trapped in her bedroom. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David Mitchell compete against Jon Richardson and Katherine Ryan. The Brett Domino Trio join Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz with guest captain Claudia Winkleman and Johnny Vegas going up against Jon Richardson and Reginald D Hunter. Sara Pascoe joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: A couple who have given themselves just two weeks to construct their new home in beachside Maianbar, south of Sydney, despite the fact that they have never built anything before.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi tries to help Sheffield couple Chris and Lynn Simmerson find their ideal retirement home on Spain's Costa Blanca and discovers their £80,000 budget stretches further than expected.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Robert Fox and his partner Kevin, who run Cherry Tree House in Blackpool, hope to be in with a chance of winning the title of best B&B as another round of the competition gets under way. However, two guests are shocked at the room prices, and an afternoon learning clown skills sees a North-South divide develop in the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Caroline Middleton host at the Old Hall Inn in North Yorkshire, where a couple of guests are unimpressed by a discovery in their bathroom, and the afternoon's angling activity leaves two more frustrated when they fail to catch a fish.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to George and Juliet Bristow's Pilot Boat Inn on the Isle of Wight, where some of the guests are amazed by the building - yet others are shocked to find cobwebs in their bedrooms. Also, the hosts' constant hovering at breakfast makes the diners feel uncomfortable.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lucy Roe welcomes her guests to Rutland Terrace in Stamford, Lincolnshire, and although they are delighted with the elegant decor, George and Juliet are unimpressed by their lack of en-suite facilities. Kevin and Robert are horrified by the state of their mattress, before being accused of attention seeking at dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps teachers Paul Gardner and Paula McKee hunt for the perfect property near Murcia, Spain, after the soon-to-be-wed pair both secured jobs at the nearby international school. The couple have set aside a budget of £200,000 for the relocation.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps father and son Richard and Rich Gansbuehler from Northampton search for a holiday home in Tarragona, northern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Bath, Somerset: Death in the Crescent.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the experts visit Bath's Royal Crescent, where they go in search of a Roman cemetery and the remains of the Fosse Way. Their quest is hampered by torrential rain and an unexpected Victorian cellar, but after three days of hard digging, they still hope to come up trumps.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Athelney, Somerset - The Guerrilla Base of the King.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on a dig at Athelney in Somerset, the fortress hiding place of King Alfred the Great, from where he went on to defeat the Danes at the Battle of Ethandun in May 878.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim, Fuzz and the team must race against the clock when they step in and restore high end car, a 1967 Lancia Flavia coupe, that has been hidden in a garage in Rochdale for 30 years.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel tries to fix a cocker spaniel's leg problems by fitting two bionic back feet, before launching a series of investigations into what is causing a cat to drag its leg. Plus, a Westie puppy with a fractured knee arrives, but it cannot keep still.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Pioneering veterinarian Noel Fitzpatrick plans to use groundbreaking cell technology to repair damaged cartilage in a 10-month-old golden retriever that helps a five-year-old girl cope with epilepsy. A cat arrives at the surgery with a suspected rat bite that seems to be getting bigger, and a whippet is brought in after being hit by a car - sustaining multiple pelvic fractures.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of architectural designer Lincoln Miles and his wife, artist Lisa Traxler, who want to create their own home on the Isle of Wight. They have bought a property on a prime piece of land and set out to convert it into a creative structure that harmonises with the unspoilt woodland setting.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire is brought to castle Leoch, and is introduced to the Laird. The nurse does her best to make friends and bides her time as a tinker may be passing by soon, but Dougal is keeping a close eye on her - and insists she stays and puts her healing skills to good use.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff at King's College Hospital treat patients on Valentine's Day, including a 53-year-old psychologist who has injured his shoulder in a motorcycle accident. His partner is abroad and he doesn't want to worry her, so he decides to keep the incident a secret. Also in the A&E department are a man with a bleed on the brain and an elderly widower who has been bitten by his dog.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Abby has had an accident at a diving pool and needs to have her head and neck scanned for serious injuries. programme.title: Bella and the Bulldogs
programme.desc: Comedy about a girl on her school's cheerleading squad who ends up becoming the American football team's star quarterback.(n)

programme.title: Hank Zipzer
programme.desc: A plan to work at his mother's deli to make money for a new pair of trainers is disrupted when Hank is given a school assignment to look after a pretend baby. He soon learns that he cannot juggle the two of them at once, but the real trouble begins when he accidentally swaps his fake infant for a real one.(n)

programme.title: Prank Patrol
programme.desc: Barney Harwood and the mischievous ninjas help another youngster pull the wool over a friend's eyes with an elaborate hidden-camera stunt.(n)

programme.title: Junior MasterChef
programme.desc: Young aspiring chefs shortlisted from 2,000 hopefuls battle it out to prove their talents in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Junior MasterChef
programme.desc: Young aspiring chefs shortlisted from 2,000 hopefuls battle it out to prove their talents in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool.
programme.desc: Homer shakes off the shackles of his traditional lifestyle after hitting it off with his trendy new neighbours, who are the ultimate in cool - although Marge isn't too keen on the hipster clan, especially their parenting style. However, when Bart falls out with one of his new friends' kids, the doughnut-loving dad soon sees them for what they really are. With the guest voices of Portlandia stars Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein, and Patton Oswalt (Young Adult).(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Leo begs David to get painkillers for Mannix from the hospital, leading to a fall-out between the pair. Paige is unsettled by Elly's interest in Mark, while Xanthe hits rock-bottom.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo undergoes emergency surgery, while Kat makes further progress in the drugs case, but Ash wants her to spend more time at home. Brody goes cold turkey, but starts hallucinating.(n)

programme.title: Making It Down Under
programme.desc: Kate's shih tzu Moon undergoes a doggie face-lift, mother-of-seven Rosie offers an insight into what it is like to have such a large brood, and flying doctor Matthew battles to keep a man alive mid-flight. Cameras follow recent Irish arrivals in Australia as they work in challenging careers. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Inside Shannon
programme.desc: Niall and the team are under pressure when the airport plays host to its first air show in 25 years. Father-and-son aerobatics team Gerry and Harry take to the skies., while an 11-year-old cancer patient from Galway receives VIP treatment. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Neven Maguire: Home Chef
programme.desc: The award-winning chef is joined by food blogger Indy Power, who shows him how to make cacao and chia seed buckwheat granola, and spiced carrot and sweet potato soup. Plus, Neven prepares stuffed aubergines with a spinach and feta pie, and pork goulash with cauliflower rice. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the first quarter-final, in which the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from a selection of ingredients including poussin, squid, mango and dark chocolate. After a double elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Tracey MacLeod, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: The entire precinct's festive holiday celebrations are cut short when officers are called to examine a ruthless homicide linked to Eddie Flores, the deranged nephew of a notable drug lord who has a previous history with Riggs. The season of goodwill is weighing heavily on Riggs however, who flashes back to past Christmases spent in the company of his late wife Miranda. Murtaugh is also a little preoccupied with his neighbour's obnoxious holiday decorations. Action drama based on the film series, starring Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: A promoter is killed at a rave party while handing out legal enhancing drugs and Riggs and Murtaugh soon find themselves in a violent turf war between a new generation of drug dealers and a Koreatown gang. The growing friction between the duo is relieved somewhat when Murtaugh is assigned a temporary new partner, while Trish attempts to set Riggs up with a date by pairing him with one of her co-workers. Action drama based on the film series, starring Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: No Offence
programme.desc: Deering leads a manhunt through Manchester as the net closes in on the serial killer. Meanwhile, Joy and Spike discover an unsettling slavery case after a brutal attack on a young homeless man.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Halloween sees the squad competing in their annual competition - and as they carry out a heist, they pull out all the stops to win the title of Ultimate Detective Slash Genius.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.desc: A devastating glitch during a mission forces Philip, Elizabeth, William and Gabriel to confront the depths of their patriotism, while in Russia, Nina puts her life on the line.(n)

programme.title: Reign
programme.desc: Drama chronicling the rise to power of Mary Stuart, the woman the world would come to know as Mary, Queen of Scots, and her life in France. Starring Adelaide Kane and Toby Regbo.(n)

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite.(n)

programme.title: Wild Kratts
programme.desc: Animation for children about two brothers who use creature power suits created from animal DNA.(n)

programme.title: Me Too
programme.desc: Everyone on the train except Mikey John wants to listen to the big football match. Raymond creates a separate quiet area to keep people happy.(n)

programme.title: Kiva Can Do
programme.desc: Animation about a five-year-old girl who knows how to make her own fun and whose imagination knows no bounds.(n)

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.sub-title: I Will Not Ever Never Forget You Nibbles.
programme.desc: The death of the duo's pet mouse Nibbles leaves Lola very upset - until the arrival of new rodent Tickles.(n)

programme.title: Bella and the Bulldogs
programme.desc: Comedy about a girl on her school's cheerleading squad who ends up becoming the American football team's star quarterback.(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Gordon and Alan travel to one of Jupiter's moons to rescue a party of astronauts who have become stranded under the ice.(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Global warming becomes a very real problem for a family trapped in a city that is being overtaken by rising ocean tides. With little time remaining, Gordon and Kayo race to the rescue. Adventure series, with the voices of David Menkin and Angel Coulby.(n)

programme.title: Sabrina the Teenage Witch
programme.desc: Sabrina's new co-worker could be a threat to her relationship with Harvey.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Steve Backshall examines the increasing pressures threatening the planet's animal populations, including tigers, gorillas and whales. He explores the various conservation efforts set up to help them and reveals a few success stories, such as the remarkable comeback of Africa's White Rhino.(n)

programme.title: Live Irish Open Golf
programme.sub-title: Golf: Dubai Duty Free Irish Open: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Joanne Cantwell is joined by John McHenry to present live coverage of day one of the European Tour event, held this year at Portstewart Golf Club in Londonderry, Northern Ireland. Home favourite Rory McIlroy won the title here 12 months ago, finishing three strokes clear of Wales' Bradley Dredge and Scotland's Russell Knox. With commentary by Shane O'Donoghue.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Elly and Mark enjoy a great day together, and it is clear that they have a developing chemistry. Xanthe suffers another setback, while David faces a moral dilemma.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin, Scarlett and Mason search frantically for Brody, while Marilyn is frustrated that John seems to be avoiding her. Roo comes to a decision about the daughter she gave away.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is furious when the university forces him to work with Kripke, while Howard's hobby lands him in financial trouble. However, that doesn't stop him and Raj getting expensive action figures of themselves made - much to Bernadette's disapproval.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six new cooks take on two challenges. The first three begin with a Skills Test set by Marcus Wareing. They have 15 minutes to make a Buck Rarebit - a Welsh Rarebit with a fried egg on top. The remaining three contestants must complete a Skills Test set by Monica Galetti, who examines their butchery skills by asking them to joint a whole rabbit and prepare it for cooking. In the final challenge the six chefs cook their own Signature Dish, before the best three are put through to the quarter finals.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: In a future ravaged by war, the superhero team makes a desperate last stand against a force of deadly robots. Their only hope is to send Wolverine back in time to the 1970s, to join forces with an earlier version of the X-Men and change the events that started the conflict. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Hugh Jackman, Jennifer Lawrence, James McAvoy and Michael Fassbender.(n)

programme.title: Other Voices
programme.desc: The show celebrating rising musical talent draws to a close with performances by Norwegian musician Ane Brun, Limerick-based outfit Bleeding Heart Pigeons and Leicester-born singer-songwriter Mahalia. programme.desc: The doctors advise patients with food phobias and calorie addictions. Dawn Harper visits the home of a 40st man who has a full-time live-in carer and suffers from several conditions including painful skin infections and boils, Pixie McKenna helps an excessive eater requiring treatment for a massive hernia and Christian Jessen meets a yo-yo dieter, as well as a woman who has never eaten fruit or vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Married to the Eiffel Tower
programme.desc: The life of Naisho, a woman who is `married' to the landmark and professes her love for the Berlin Wall, stopping short of physical intimacy only because they are so public. One of only 40 people in the world identified as `objectum sexuals', she has similar feelings for San Francisco's Golden Gate Bridge, and was discharged from the US army on psychological grounds as a result of childhood abuse.(n)

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: Focusing on Denise Holsinger, who was involved with her boyfriend in the fatal shooting of four people at an inn, and Vanessa Crawley, who lured a man into a car so her husband could rob and murder him.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The murder of Tara Lynn Grant, reported missing in February 2007 by her husband Stephen, but whose dismembered body parts were later found in their home. Police managed to track Grant, by now a fugitive, to a state park in Northern Michigan and arrested him before he froze to death.(n)

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A case involving a 69-year-old man with a gunshot wound to the back of the head found slumped over the rail of a footbridge. A gun was found in found in a holster on the man's waist, and medic Jan Garavaglia finds multiple clues indicating that the man had fired his own gun prior to his death.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: Cold Justice
programme.desc: The murder of Kirby Smith, an avid dirt-track racer who had been building cars since he was a teenager. He was found shot dead at his shop in March 2004, and it wasn't until a decade later that two people were charged with the killing.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes
programme.desc: A family holiday ends in a serious road accident, but paramedic Darren Axe has to hitch a lift to the scene in a passing car when the chopper is grounded by fog. Presented by Rav Wilding.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team apply their expertise to the task of assembling a handmade kitchen in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire. Meanwhile, Kate McIntyre introduces three more families in need of help.(n)

programme.desc: The medics are confronted by a difficult patient in the form of a nurse, and race to save a farm worker trapped in machinery. Elsewhere, a pensioner's car careers down a hillside. Presented by Rav Wilding.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Duxford.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles heads to Duxford in Cambridgeshire, where he enlists the help of local tradespeople to assist Paul and Sarah Behan. The couple had started on an extension to their small bungalow when the project had to be abandoned due to their son Joshua being diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of liver cancer. The team puts in an impressive effort, but with only nine days to finish the job the challenge is extensive.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Weight Loss
programme.desc: Forty-four-year-old Jackie Rodriguez has struggled with her weight ever since her son was injured by shaken baby syndrome, while in the care of a nanny 15 years earlier. Since then her weight has more than doubled. Expert trainer Chris Powell helps her face her pain, anger and guilt over what happened to her son and drop to something in the region of 140lbs.(n)

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: Notorious female prisoners, featuring Jackie Alexander who is serving life, without possibility for parole, for the murder of her room-mate Thomas Hammond. Plus, Heather Frango explains how she ended up behind bars after her son was mauled to death by pit bull dogs.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Chris and Simon arrest a biker who is armed with nunchucks, while Charlie and Ruffy pursue a boy racer. Elsewhere, pensioners cause problems on the road, and shopkeepers in America fight back against would-be thieves.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Roma and Ronnie are shocked when a driver in Slough, Berkshire, records the highest reading they have ever seen in a breathalyser test, and Chris captures an innovative supermarket thief. The Liverpool Air Support Unit uses heat-sensing cameras to track down a criminal who has taken refuge underneath Blackpool pier.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Series following the rescue and rehabilitation of more than 160 neglected and abused primates at the Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Dorset, which the founder and his wife built into a 65-acre wildlife park that is home to 15 species.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen's father Garrison is found in the hospital room of an NCIS patient during a radiation poisoning case, and Callen must take him to the boatshed for interrogation. Plus, the team discusses their plans for Thanksgiving. Guest starring Daniel J Travanti.(n)

programme.sub-title: Ua ola loko i ke aloha (Love Gives Life Within).
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate when unstable Second World War bombs left behind by the Japanese are stolen, while McGarrett's Aunt Deb visits Oahu on a very personal mission to finish her recently deceased husband's bucket list. Guest starring Carol Burnett.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover heads to Chicago to extract a confession from old friend Clay Maxwell, who is suspected of murdering his wife, while two killers hold Chin and Kono at gunpoint, unaware they are police officers, Guest starring Mykelti Williamson (Forrest Gump).(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A graduate student developing a weapon for the navy is attacked and the team discovers a connection to international warfare. Kensi continues with her gruelling physical therapy.(n)

programme.title: Stargate Atlantis
programme.desc: Beckett creates a potion designed to convert Wraiths back to human form. The team is surprised to encounter a mysterious girl in the early stages of the experiment, and Sheppard's life is inadvertently put at risk.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The return of the American comedy about a man and his extended family living in three different households. Recent events force Haley and Andy to cope with their emotions in different ways, while Jay and Gloria are in for a shock when they start looking for a pre-school for Joe. Plus, Cam attempts to remain supportive of Mitch's midlife career crisis, but when money begins to get tight, he hatches a plan. Ed O'Neill Stars.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: The Day Alex Left for College.
programme.desc: Phil and Claire feel rejected when Alex deliberately tells them the wrong date for her moving-in day at college as she wants to keep things as low-key as possible, while Luke makes it clear he would rather hang out with schoolfriends than spend the day with his dad. Elsewhere, the rest of the family come up with an elaborate excuse to avoid going to Lily's football game, and things get stressful for Mitch and Cam now after they decided to rent out their top floor.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender begins dating the Planet Express ship, but soon grows bored and decides to dump her - just when she is flying the crew away from a furious Omicronian death fleet. The robot is forced to agree to merge his programming with his former lover's, while Fry and Leela desperately try to shut her down before she can fly them all into a quasar. Featuring the voices of Sigourney Weaver and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa develops a crush on school bully Nelson, while Homer gets hold of an automatic dialling device used by telemarketing companies and uses it to bombard the people of Springfield with calls asking for money.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Ned Flanders' home is destroyed by a hurricane, so his well-meaning friends and neighbours rally round to attempt to rebuild it. Unfortunately, their shoddy workmanship causes him to give up on life and suffer a nervous breakdown.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Our Homer).
programme.desc: An overdose of spicy Mexican food at the local chilli festival causes Homer to experience a series of hallucinations that inspire him to set out in search of his true soulmate. Featuring the guest voice of Johnny Cash as a talking coyote.(n)

programme.title: Flintoff: Lord of the Fries
programme.desc: Andrew `Freddie' Flintoff reunites with cyclist Rob Penn to go on another set of adventures in their eco-friendly chip van. programme.title: Karl Pilkington: The Moaning of Life
programme.desc: Karl Pilkington tries to find out how people achieve happiness, something he isn't sure it is worth pursuing. In Mexico, he joins members of a tribe who enjoy running ultra-marathons and meets a group that finds pleasure in pain. In LA he hangs out with some hip-hop clowns, experiences a day of beauty with a plastic-surgery addict and gives up his possessions to see if the simple life is the answer to contentment.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard, the owners of Carlton Towers near Selby in North Yorkshire, prepare to host a fitness boot camp weekend at their property - while also welcoming an array of guests to celebrate their son's birthday. programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor explores Ireland's best hotels, beginning by visiting the beautiful Ashford Castle which provided the setting for the 1952 film The Quiet Man. Together with Classic FM presenter John Suchet, Richard then checks in at the Belfast Europa, which is known as most bombed hotel in Europe after being attacked 28 times during the Troubles, before taking a tour of the Clarence Hotel in Dublin, which is owned by U2 frontman Bono. Finally, he visits the exclusive six-star Ballyfin, where guests are granted the chance to be lord and lady of the manor during their stay.(n)

Elsewhere, Carmela takes a more active role in Tony's therapy. Gritty crime drama, starring James Gandolfini, Lorraine Bracco and Edie Falco.(n)

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: A dancer having an affair with Ralph enrages him when she insults him, leading Tony to take retribution on her behalf. Meadow' social life at college takes a sudden turn for the worse when her room-mate Caitlin antagonises her boyfriend. Gritty crime drama, starring James Gandolfini, Joe Pantoliano and Jamie-Lynn DiScala.(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie
programme.desc: Mrs Akalitus's former mentor makes a surprise return to All Saints when he arrives for an angioplasty, but is suffering from dementia and believes he is still an employee. Jackie has a meeting with her brusque new divorce lawyer, who convinces her she needs to be tough if she wants to win custody of the kids. Zoey tries to pluck up the courage to dump Lenny, and Cruz's lack of sympathy makes matters much worse when a patient gets injured. Guest starring Joel Grey (Cabaret) and Aida Turturro (The Sopranos).(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: After the White House is locked down following a shooting, Josh interviews a potential candidate to replace Ainsley Hayes, while President Bartlet deals with a spy plane shot down over Russia, and the rest of the staff play a game of poker while discussing military affairs. Drama about the US president and his aides, guest starring Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: During his first day, Joe Quincy finds three pieces of information which lead to an unsettling discovery and the unravelling of a high-level scandal. American political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Everyday life at Northumberland's Chillingham Castle, where the members of staff try to tactfully deal with the whims of their employer, baronet Humphry Wakefield, as the estate prepares to welcome a band of ghost-hunting tourists. Meanwhile, Carlton Towers in East Yorkshire hosts an annual dog show for Afghan hounds.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard try to impress American guests at Carlton Towers with a programme of traditional activities, including skinning rabbits and taking high tea. Meanwhile, Sir Humphry Wakefield entertains tourists on a wine-tasting weekend at Chillingham Castle.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor's series exploring the world's most luxurious hotels concludes on the glamorous French Riviera. Beginning at the Hotel de Paris in Monaco, he is shown the art of perfect fine dining before meeting ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard, who explains why he chooses to call Monaco home. Richard then visits the Hotel Byblos in St Tropez, where Mick Jagger and Bianca De Macias tied the knot in 1971, before paying a visit to Belles Rivers.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor returns to explore more of the world's most luxurious hotels and begins in Miami's South Beach, home to some of the most hedonistic and extravagant establishments in America. At the Fontainebleau, he meets a man with eye-opening stories about Frank Sinatra's regular visits and gets a shock when he discovers how much it costs to hire a booth in the night club. Richard also gatecrashes swimwear fashion week at the Raleigh Hotel, where he speaks to the event manager about the many celebrity parties he has organised.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The US is placed on a high state of alert after two terrorists go missing, and President Bartlet has trouble finding the words for a message he wants to convey to his daughter's graduating class at university. American political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Timothy Busfield.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet confronts a national crisis on the eve of his daughter's graduation from university, forcing him to shut down Washington DC and order a fleet to the Persian Gulf. Toby finds time to savour a personal milestone. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Elisabeth Moss.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Part two of two. The desperate kidnapper realises Samantha is an FBI agent and shoots her, forcing Jack to make a deal to ensure she receives medical attention. Meanwhile, the rest of the team members hunt for the missing Sydney Harrison. Poppy Montgomery stars.(n)

programme.desc: As the search for President Bartlet's daughter continues, the White House staff struggle to cope with the implications of the crisis and even as they work, other issues rear their ugly heads.
